My husband is a daily wage laborer. I operate an embroidered clothes business. I stay at home and embroider clothes, and my son takes these clothes to the market and sells them. I am able to generate reasonable profits out of this business. I need a loan of $200 to expand my business further.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig is a single man who lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1977. Natig sells foodstuffs (tea, sweets, butter, etc.) in his store.  Natig has run this business for the past 5 years.  Now this young man needs a loan of $950 to buy foodstuffs to increase his inventory and improve his income.

loans.use: To buy additional food to sell

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: My name is Rubina S.. I am a mother of four sons, all of whom attend school except the youngest. We own a three-room brick house here in Multan, a midsize city in Paksitan. My husband needs a loan of $325 for his wholesale business. He supplies various items such as spices, candies and pulses to various shops in the city. This loan will help us increase our income substantially.

loans.use: Buy items such as spices, candies and pulses (grains) for the business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: N. Maryam is a mother of 4 children. She was born in 1959. Maryam lives with her family in Khachmaz town. She has been selling  nuts, hazelnuts, beechnuts, etc. in the market for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $850 to increase her goods for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy produce and nuts to sell

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en: My name is Manzoor B. from a mid-size city, Multan, a city famous for its pottery, in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of three girls, all of whom attend school except the youngest who is small and not of school-going age yet. I embroider clothes on order from various shopkeepers and at times from my neighborhood women. My husband manufactures some machine spare parts. Please lend him $325 to improve his business further.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana (her husband is pictured) is a mother of one child. She is 31 years old and lives with her family in Khachmaz town. Her husband makes gates. Now they need a loan of $950 to purchase the necessary materials for making gates.

loans.use: To buy materials for making gates

loans.name: Minakhanim

texts.en: Minakhanim (her husband is pictured) has 5 children. She and her family live in Khachmaz town. She was born in 1965. Her husband has repaired vehicles for a year. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy necessary materials for repairing the vehicles to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for repairing the vehicles

loans.name: Noël

texts.fr:
Mr Noël L. is 43 years old and is a married and father of one (1) child. Having grown up in a poor family, he quickly had to quit school and instead started training as a shoemaker. Without the financial means to start this endeavor, he is asking for a $500 credit to initially rent a workshop space and the second time to acquire leather and other materials and supplies to be able to make and sell shoes and bags. This will enable him to improve his family's living conditions and to increase his production so that he can meet the needs of his customers.

Agé de 43 ans, Monsieur L. Noël est marié et père d’un (1) enfant. Issu d’une famille pauvre, il a vite quitté les bancs de l’école et s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de la cordonnerie. Manque de moyen, il sollicite un crédit de $500 pour dans un premier temps loyer un atelier et pour un second temps acquérir d’autres matériels et fournitures et de cuire intrants de la fabrication de chaussures et sacs pour la commercialisation. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie familiale et accroître le rendement de ses activités afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Lease of a workshop and purchase of leather for shoe making

loans.name: Boèvi Jacob

texts.fr:
Mr L. Boèvi Jacob is a 43 year-old married man, a father of two (2) children, who also takes care of another person. With only a secondary education, he is learning the shoe-making trade in order to relieve his family's financial suffering. Through this project, he is asking for a loan of $600 which will enable him to build his workshop and purchase leather and other materials. This wil improve the living conditions of his family and help them find their dignity both economically and socially.

Agé de 43 ans monsieur L. Boèvi Jacob est marié et père de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge une (1) personne. Avec son niveau d’instruction secondaire, il apprend la cordonnerie afin de palier aux maux dont souffrent sa famille en matière de support financier. Il demande à travers ce projet un prêt de $600 qui lui permettra de renforcer son atelier en matériel et cuir afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille pour retrouver sa dignité d’une manière économique et sociale.

loans.use: Building of workshop

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr:
Born in 1981 Mr A. Samuel is unmarried and takes care of three (3) people. Born in a poor family, he could not be educated and was therefore trained as a shoemaker. Having obtained his diploma of end of training 15 months ago, he decided to open a workshop, but without the means, he requests a financing of $400 which will help him buy material and supplies for the workshop so that he can meet his customers' needs. Thanks to this activity, he will be able to support himself as well as his three brothers.

Né en 1981 Monsieur A. Samuel est célibataire avec trois (3) personnes à sa charge. Né d’une famille pauvre il n’a pas pu évoluer dans ses études et entre en apprentissage de la cordonnerie. Ayant obtenu son diplôme de fin d’apprentissage il y a 15 mois, il décida d’ouvrir un atelier mais n’ayant pas de moyens, il sollicite un financement de $400 qui lui permettra l’achat de matériel et de fourniture de cordonnerie afin de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Grâce à cette activité, il arrive moyennement à se supporter et également ses trois frères.

loans.use: Opening of a shoe making workshop and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Komlan Faustin

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Komlan Faustin est né le 21 Mai 1963 à Lomé et père d’un (1) enfant et une autre personne en charge. Par manque de moyen, il abandonne sa formation en informatique et apprend la cordonnerie. Ayant reçu son diplôme après sa formation, il sollicite un crédit de $600 afin d’ouvrir un atelier et acquérir des fournitures et matériels de cordonnerie pour faire ressortir son savoir faire à sa clientèle. Bien organiser, il pense avoir plus tard un crédit plus consistant pour associé à la cordonnerie d’autres initiatives du genre commercial. Son dynamisme et son habileté constituent autant d’atouts pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: Achat de matériel de cordonnerie et ouverture d'un atelier

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa (her husband is pictured) was born in 1952. She lives with her family in Khachmaz town. This woman has 4 children. Her husband has cooked kabobs for 4 years. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy sheep for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy sheep for cooking kabobs.

loans.name: Komlan Faustin

texts.fr:
Mr A. Komlan Faustin was born on May 21, 1963 in Lomé and is the father of one (1) child. He also takes care of another person. Because of financial difficulties, he had to give up his training in data processing and learn how to make shoes instead. Having received a diploma after this training, he is asking for a $600 credit in order to open a workshop and buy supplies and materials for shoe manufacturing so that he can demonstrate his knowledge and get new customers. A well organized man, he would like to later on, obtain a more consistent credit for his workshop as well as other commercial initiatives. His dynamism and skill are also important assets that will contribute to the success of his project.

Monsieur A. Komlan Faustin est né le 21 Mai 1963 à Lomé et père d’un (1) enfant et une autre personne en charge. Par manque de moyen, il abandonne sa formation en informatique et apprend la cordonnerie. Ayant reçu son diplôme après sa formation, il sollicite un crédit de $600 afin d’ouvrir un atelier et acquérir des fournitures et matériels de cordonnerie pour faire ressortir son savoir faire à sa clientèle. Bien organiser, il pense avoir plus tard un crédit plus consistant pour associé à la cordonnerie d’autres initiatives du genre commercial. Son dynamisme et son habileté constituent autant d’atouts pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and opening of a shoe making workshop

loans.name: Blaise

texts.fr:
Born on the 1st of February 1979, Mr G. Blaise is single and is responsible for one person. President of his neighborhood, he is a tailor by profession. He has abandonned his principal activity and is launching into a business selling wood coal and cereals. To do that he needs some business capital. That is why he is asking for a loan of $800 to increase his purchasing capacity and to better serve his clients. This will allow him to better finance his business, give it a new lease on life and improve its' performance.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 1er Février 1979, Monsieur G. Blaise est célibataire avec une personne à charge. Président dans son quartier, il est couturier de profession. Ayant abandonné son activité principale, il se lança dans le commerce de charbon de bois et des céréales, ce qui suscite assez de fonds. Pour cela il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat et de servir plus fidèlement sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de plus financer son activité et donnera un second souffle et l’amélioration surtout dans ses prestations.

loans.use: buying and selling wood coal and cereals

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona (her husband is pictured) lives with her family in Khachmaz town. She is a mother of 3 children. Sona was born in 1962. Her husband has sold building materials for 2 years. Now this family needs a loan of $950 to increase the variety of building materials, to attract more clients and get more income.

loans.use: To increase the variety of building materials

loans.name: Apélété

texts.fr:
Mr. A. Apélété is 25 years old and is single. He has just finished his apprenticeship as a shoemaker and is asking for a loan of $1,000 to open a shoemakers shop and to purchase materials and equipment. His plan is to make shoes and handbags of leather and synthetic that could be commercialized for a larger market. The realization of this dream will contribute to improving his economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Apélété, âgé de 25 ans est célibataire. Sortie tout fraîchement de son apprentissage de cordonnerie, il demande par le biais de ce projet un financement de $1000 pour l’ouverture d’un atelier et l’acquisition de matériels et fournitures de la cordonnerie. Son programme est de fabriquer des chaussures et sacs en cuir et synthétique qui seront destinés à la commercialisation afin de gagner une marche bénéficiaire pour subvenir à ses besoins. La réalisation de ce rêve contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions économiques et sociales de sa personnalité.

loans.use: Opening of shoemakers shop and the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad (his brother is pictured) was born in 1983. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Now these young men need a loan of $950 to buy audio and video cassettes for increasing their incomes.

loans.use: To buy audio and video cassettes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel works providing services in auto body repair/ painting of private and public vehicles. His wife is a fruit merchant and with both incomes they provide for their 5 children - the two oldest being 15 & 17 years old help their father in his work. They live in the area of Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto. This is the second credit KIVA they are requesting. The previous loan was repaid prior to its original maturity date. His new loan will be applied to the purchase of a work tool "oxygen tank" so that he can improve his workshop and generate more income for his family. It is the second loan through Impro, which he's allowed due to his good behavior in paying the first one off.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Daniel presta servicios de chaperia y repintado de vehículos particulares y públicos; la esposa es comerciante ambulante de frutas y de esta manera ellos consiguen sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a sus cinco hijos, los dos mayores de 15 y 17 años de edad son los ayudantes del padre. Viven en la zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto. Es el segundo crédito con KIVA; el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado con anticipación a su vencimiento original. Su microempresa paulatinamente se va reactivando y este nuevo préstamo lo aplicara en la compra de herramienta de trabajo “tanque de oxigeno” de esa forma podrá mejorar su taller y generar mayores ingresos para la familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase an oxygen tank for his auto body shop. (Compra de tanque de oxigeno para su taller de chaperia y pintado de autos)

loans.name: Luis R.

texts.es:
Luis is a dairy farmer and is currently going to school to be a mechanic. He works part-time as a mechanical helper, these are the two main sources of income for him. With these salaries he is able to cover tuition for his school and at the same time help his parents support his yournger sibling.

He lives in Achica Bajo Community (two and a half miles from La Paz, the main capital).

The credit he requests will be used to purchase a cow which will help the increase of milk production; this way he will increase his earnings.

This is his second loan with Impro; evaluation will be done in order to approve his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Luís es productor de leche de vaca y estudiante de mecánica automotriz, también esta trabajado medio día como ayudante de mecánica, de estas dos actividades se derivan sus principales ingresos con los que alcanza a cubrir sus estudios y ayudar a sus padres para la manutención de sus hermanitos. Vive en la Comunidad de Achica Bajo (A dos y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of more cows

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is forty-two years old and a single mother of three girls ages twenty, seventeen, and fourteen.  Each of Dominga’s daughters attend school, with the eldest studying at the local university.  Dominga purchases new and used shoes in bulk and resells these at a profit to passers-by on the local roads of her community.

Dominga plans on using her loan to increase the selection of used clothing and new and used shoes in her inventory.  She hopes that soon her business will become established enough that she can serve customers exclusively from her home.  As she works to support her children’s educations, Dominga explains that she hopes her three daughters will all receive their university degrees and live the lives of their dreams.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and shoes for resale locally.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti A. is 23 years old, married with one child aged 8. Her husband, Hendra, has no fixed income. So, to provide the family's needs, she sells cellphone accessories and prepaid phone vouchers at her small kiosk. She usually earns about US$ 20 per week and that is not enough to cover her family's daily needs. She's requesting a loan to expand her business. Siti A. is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cellphone accessories

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is forty years old.  She and her husband are the proud parents of two boys and two girls who range in age from ten to twenty-five years old.  Juliana sells new men's and women’s clothing to customers who make their purchases insiD. her home.  

Juliana mentions that word-of-mouth travels quickly in her community and the new clothing selection she purchases with her loan will surely spark interest in her business.  Juliana explains that she and several other local clothing vendors have a friendly competition in offering new products and she looks forward to bolstering her inventory.  She hopes that the continued success of her business will support her family and allow her children the opportunity to attend a university.

loans.use: Purchase of new men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in a variety of fruit

loans.name: Umi

texts.en: Umi is 33-year-old woman who sells vegetables at her small shop and earns about US$ 5 per day. Previously, she sold food, but that business did not run very well, so she would like to concentrate on vegetable sales in the future. Her husband, U., sells foods and only earns a small income. Umi is requesting a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business selling vegetables

loans.name: Nasa

texts.en: Nasa is 35-year-old woman who sells snacks, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, and usually earns about US$ 30 per week. Her husband, J., sells vegetables and usually earns about US$ 50 per day with a small profit. Nasa is requesting a loan to fill her shop with more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Rohana

texts.en: Rohana is 46-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, leaving her to work hard by herself to cover the family's daily needs.  She sells snacks, drinks, candies, and household goods, and usually earns US$ 10 per day. Rohana is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can pay tuition for her children's schooling. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her  little general store

loans.name: Nurmilah

texts.en:
Nurmilah is 28-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks and drinks, and also household products. She can earn about US$ 100 per month with a small profit. Her husband, C., has no fixed income. She is requesting a loan to expand her and her husband's business.

Nurmilah hopes that she can increase her income so she can provide her children's tuition. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her and her husband's small store

loans.name: Mary Crisleyda

texts.en:
Mary is twenty-seven years old and she and her husband have two children.  Mary's husband works as a mechanic and her young son and daughter, three and one years old respectively, stay at home with mom.

Mary sells clothing and fashion products to the women in her community.  From her home,  she offers women’s dress shoes, pants, blouses, and a selection of silver jewelry.  With her loan, Mary plans on adding more silver bracelets, necklaces and earrings, which she believes will increase her profit margin.  Mary explains that as her business becomes more established she hopes she can ensure that her children receive an education and maintain her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry and women's clothing to expand home business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in her products for retail

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.en:
Reyna is thirty years old and sells housewares and kitchen items to women in her community.  Reyna explains that she pays close attention to customer demand and when her patrons ask for a certain item she adds it to her inventory.  

With her loan Reyna plans on purchasing customer recommended products to add to her current stock.  Reyna mentions that local women visit her home to purchase curtains tablecloths, irons, table-settings and cookware.  She hopes to become the most well established supplier of these goods in her area.

loans.use: Purchase of houseware products including curtains and tablecloths to expand her home business.

loans.name: Rosa Iris

texts.en:
Rosa is a twenty-nine year old mother of four.  Her two boys and two girls range from four months to seven years old.  Her two eldest children attend school.  Rosa operates her own luncheonette where she serves freshly prepared chicken, salads, squeezed juices and other traditionally prepared Dominican dishes.

With her loan Rosa plans on stocking more of the meats, fruits and vegetables with which she prepares her meals.  She hopes that as she has more foodstuffs available, she can serve more food daily and build a larger business with a greater number of customers.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for the preparation of Dominican dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more fruit and invest in a new cart

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.en:
Xiomara is a twenty-one year old new mother.  She balances her responsibilities as an entrepreneur and mom with her studies at the local university.  Xiomara sells new and used clothing as well as tennis shoes to men and women in her community.  

She humbly explains that her selection of clothes and sneakers is still limited but, with her loan, she plans on supplementing her inventory with new styles of men's and women’s shoes.  Xiomara’s business supports her university tuition but she also hopes that she will be able “to help her parents” as they grow older, as well.

loans.use: Purchase of new men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos is a wrought iron technician. He buys, sells and repairs household appliances. His wife cleans homes for a living. This is the way they both earn a living. They have 3 children; two boys and one girl. They are all school-aged children. They live in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliacion in Managua. This neighborhood is one of many neighborhoods with a high juvenile delinquency rate. The loan requested is to install a gate in the front part of the house. This is necessary in order to give the family the necessary security that they need, robberies are happening in his neighborhood on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Carlos Técnico en Soldadura Electrónica, compra, vende y repara electrodomésticos, su esposa trabaja de doméstica, ambas actividades son la fuente de ingreso de esta familia. Ellos tienen 3 hijos dos varones y una mujer, todos en edad escolar. Habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, este barrio es uno de los muchos barrios con alto índice de delincuencia juvenil. El crédito es requerido para cerrar el porche de su casa porque se ha vuelto una necesidad para darle seguridad a su familia y a los equipos con los que trabaja, debido a los numerosos robos que en ese barrio se registran diariamente.

loans.use: Purchase of wrough iron and concrete to be able to enclose his front porch.

loans.name: Evelyn Yamir

texts.en:
Evelyn, a twenty-four year old newlywed, is the owner and operator of a small restaurant in the Camito community of Yamasa, Dominican Republic.  The traditional Dominican meals and juices Evelyn freshly prepares make her restaurant an important gathering place for the community.  Currently, Evelyn is only able to serve dinner but she plans on using her loan to expand her business and serve meals throughout the day.

Evelyn’s expansion plans include the construction of a concrete patio adjacent to her restaurant and the purchase of several benches.  Here, she can serve more customers alongside her restaurant.  As her business grows,  she would like to offer breakfast, lunch and dinner.   Evelyn mentions that she would also like to hire several employees.  As she discusses her dreams for the future, Evelyn explains that she hopes that her restaurant’s success will help her to attend a university.

loans.use: Construction of an outdoor seating area for restaurant

loans.name: Felicita Maria

texts.es:
Felicita Maria is 49 years old. She lives in the Sector Alto Moche del District Moche, Province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad. She has 3 children who still depend on her for support. Felicita Maria has a beauty salon where she offers services of haircuts, makeup application, hair coloring, skin and hand care. Before starting her business Felicita worked in an office but there was reduction of staff and she was one of the people dismissed. When she was let go, she didn't know what to do, but then decided to take up a course in cosmetology. She was also sewing and designing clothes during the evenings for some customers. Later, with a friend's suggestion, she decided to join the group "Los Jazmines" and her first loan was for S /. 300.00 soles. This money helped her purchase products for her salon, like: a dozen dyes, perm solution, creams, treatments for the scalp and hair, etc. She plans on repaying this loan in 4 months. Her greatest dream is to expand her business and build a Center for Occupational Education where she will be able to pass on her knowledge.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felicita María tiene 49 años, vive en el Sector Alto Moche del Distrito de Moche, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen de ella. La señora Felicita tiene su peluquería en donde ofrece servicio de corte de pelo, maquillaje, tintes, limpieza de cutis y cuidado de manos. Antes de poner este negocio la señora Felicita trabajaba en una oficina pero hubo reducción de personal y fue una de las despedidas, en ese momento no sabia que hacer y tuvo la idea de estudiar un curso de cosmetología asimismo por las noches confeccionaba ropa que le pedían algunos clientes. Se integra al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Los Jazmines” por medio de una amiga, su primer crédito fue de S/. 300.00 soles este dinero le sirvió para comprar material para su peluquería e implementarla. Con este préstamo de S/.300.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará una docena de tintes, liquido para ondulación, cremas, ampollas para el cabello, etc. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y construir un Centro de Educación Ocupacional en el que pueda transmitir sus conocimientos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her beauty salon, such as:  dyes, creams, products for the hair and scalp, perm solution, etc.  (Compra de insumos.)

loans.name: Esperanza Gloria

texts.es:
Esperanza lives in the spa town of Las Delicias, in the Trujillo province. She is 38 years old and finished secondary school. She has four children who depend on her. She has a business in the market of Las Delicias selling vegetables, grocery items, ground peppers and condiments. She used to dedicate herself to taking care of her home, but 9 years ago she had the idea to start a business in the market, and since then she has not stopped working.

Esperanze is a member of the group called Mientras Tanto, Siempre Unidas (always united). She received her first loan through this group which she used to buy the blender she needed to grind the peppers. The one she had was in very bad condition. With this loan, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy rice, potatoes, canned goods, onions and condiments. Her dream is to have her own shop one day, as she currently has to rent the space she has.

La señora Esperanza vive en el balneario Las Delicias del Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 38 años de edad; estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Actualmente tiene su negocio en el mercado de Las Delicias, vende verduras, abarrotes, ajíes molidos y condimentos, anteriormente se dedicaba a su hogar, hace 9 años tuvo la idea de emprender este negocio en el mercado, desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar. La señora Esperanza es una de las socias fundadoras del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Unidas” en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró una licuadora que necesitaba para moler los ajíes ya que la que tenía estaba en muy mal estado. Con este préstamo de S/.1,000 que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará conservas, arroz, papa, cebolla y condimentos. El sueño de la señora Esperanza es tener un puesto propio porque el que tiene es alquilado.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, CANNED GOODS, ETC TO BETTER STOCK HER SMALL BUSINESS, GROWING HER BUSINESS AND SAVING ENOUGH TO ONE DAY HAVE HER OWN SHOP.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Milagr

texts.es:
Gloria is 40 years old and studied tailoring in school. She has 2 children who are dependent on her. They live in the spa town of Las Delicias in the Trujillo district. Gloria sells beauty products, and also makes clothing by request. In addition, in her house she has set up a shop where she offers small quantities of grocery items, sweets, bread and eggs. She began her clothing business because she studied tailoring, but the majority of people preferred ready made clothing, so she left that work and took a job as a worker in an asparagus factory. When she became pregnant she had to leave her work, but with her small savings she was able to set up her little shop, and later, she took advantage of the opportunity to sell beauty products.

With the first loan she received through the group called Mientras Tanto, Siempre Unidas (always united), she purchased milk and oil to stock her new business. With this new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy fabric and other materials to create party dresses as she has requests for an upcoming children's party. She will also use some of the loan to purchase eggs, rice, oil, and other items she needs to stock up on.

La señora Gloria de Los Milagros tiene 40 años de edad, estudiÓ una carrera técnica y tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el balneario de Las Delicias en el Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la confección de ropa según pedidos, además en su casa a instalado una pequeña bodega en donde ofrece, en pequeñas cantidades, abarrotes, golosinas, pan y huevos. Inició su negocio confeccionando ropa porque estudió corte y confección pero como la mayoría de gente ahora prefiere comprar ropa confeccionada dejó de hacerlo y buscó trabajo como obrera en una fábrica envasadora de espárragos: quedó embarazada y tuvo que dejar el trabajo, con lo poco que pudo ahorrar implementó una pequeña bodega y luego se le presentó la oportunidad de vender productos de belleza. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Unidas” compró leche y aceite para surtir más su bodega. Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 que pagará en cuatro meses, comprará telas y otros materiales para confeccionar vestidos de fiesta porque tiene pedidos para una fiesta de promoción de niñas pequeñas y también invertirá una parte en comprar huevos, arroz, aceite que hacen falta en su bodega.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FABRIC TO MAKE CLOTHING,  AS WELL AS PURCHASE ITEMS SUCH AS RICE AND EGGS TO STOCK HER SMALL SHOP.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is 48 years old and finished secondary school. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo, and runs a business from her home, selling stuffed animals and fabric bags, as well as perfumes, gifts and other novelty items. She used to just take care of her home, but she took advantage of a course offered in her neighborhood, and since then she has practiced what she learned to build her business.

With the first loan she received from the communal bank, JERID - Camino al Exito (road to success), she purchased the material she needed to make the stuffed animals such as fabric, stuffing, buttons and decorations and the tools she needed to create the toys. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, Irene will travel to Lima to buy clothing, kitchen items such as glasses, plates and cups, and toys to for the Christmas season. Her dream is to one day have a large store.

La señora Irene tiene 48 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz del Distrito de Salaverry, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Actualmente la señora Irene se dedica a confeccionar peluches, carteras tejidas los cuales vende en la tienda que tiene en su domicilio a parte de eso vende perfumes, regalos, adornos, etc. Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a su hogar pero aprovechó un curso que dictaban en el comedor de su zona, desde allí pone en practica lo aprendido. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “JERID – Camino al Éxito” compró el material que necesita para confeccionar los peluches como: ojitos, tela, rellenos, perlas, etc. y sus herramientas. Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, viajará a Lima para traer ropa, menaje de cocina (tazas, platos, vasos, etc.) y juguetes aprovechando la campaña navideña. La señora Irene pertenece al club de madres “Purísima Concepción”, su mayor sueño es tener una gran boutique.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CLOTHING AND OTHER ITEMS,  TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE HOLIDAY SEASON TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Lucrecia Angelica

texts.es:
Lucrecia Angelica is 47 years old and was only able to attend school up until her first year of high school. She has 4 children, 1 of them is still dependent on her. They live in the district of Moche in the Trujillo province.

Lucrecia used to sell small quantities of vegetables and grocery items in the market of Moche, but it was exhausting to carry the items back and forth every day. So she decided to start a business from her home. Her niece invited her to join the group called Mientras Tanto, and with the first loan she was able to stock her new business with sugar, noodles and rice. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy sacks of sugar, rice, oil, salt, and sodas from a wholesaler in Trujillo, getting better prices and increasing her profits. Lucrecia's goal is to expand her business.

La señora Lucrecia Angélica tiene 47 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta el primer grado de educación secundaria y tiene 4 hijos pero solo 1 depende de ella. Vive en el Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Anteriormente la señora Lucrecia vendía en el mercado de Moche un poco de verduras y abarrotes pero era muy agotador llevar y traer los productos todos los días, por lo que decide empezar a vender en su casa. En ese momento una sobrina le invitó a ingresar al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Señor de la Piedad” y el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300.00 soles le fue de gran utilidad porque con ellos pudo surtir su bodega comprando fideos, azúcar, arroz. Con este préstamo de S/.700.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará un saco de arroz, una bolsa de azúcar, un bidón de aceite, un paquete de sal y gaseosas en un mercado mayorista de Trujillo para conseguir mejores precios. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ITEMS WHOLESALE SUCH AS RICE, SUGAR, OIL AND SODAS TO STOCK HER SMALL SHOP, IMPROVE HER PROFITS BY SECURING BETTER PRICING, AND MOVE CLOSER TO HER GOAL OF EXPANDING HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeth is 43 years old and finished her high school eduction. She and her 4 children live in the area of Campina de Moche in Trujillo. She works preparing dairy products such as cheeses and yogurts, as well raising dairy cows whose milk she sells to a large company. She is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante (always forward), from which she received her first loan to buy materials for making and packaging yogurt. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase feed for the cows, and several molds for making chocolate. Her greatest dream is to see her children with good professions.

La señora Maria Elizabeth tiene 43 años de edad, estudio superior completa y tiene 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Campiña de Moche del Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad - Perú Actualmente la señora Maria Elizabeth elabora productos lácteos (manjar blanco, queso, quesillo, toffes, yogurt) además cría ganado y vende leche a una empresa grande del país es por eso que se animó a preparar productos derivados de la leche ya que cuenta con el insumo. La señora María Elizabeth es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró bolsas para envasar yogurt y cultivos para elaborarlo. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará alimento para el ganado y unos cuanto moldes para la preparación de las chocotejas. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FEED FOR HER DAIRY COWS, AND MATERIALS NEEDED TO MAKE DAIRY PRODUCTS.

loans.name: Maria Zoila

texts.es:
Maria Zoila is 71 years old and still works hard. She studied up until her second year of high school. She has 12 children, but only 2 still depend on her. They live in the area of Campina D. Moche in Trujillo. She has a business preparing sweets and snacks, which she sells in in her town and in the spa town of Las Delicias. Maria Zoila is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante (always forward), from which she received her first loan to purchase chocolate and dried fruit to begin her business. With the new loan, she will purchase molds for the chocolate, milk, chocolate and dried fruit. Her dream is to have a sweet shop in the city of Trujillo.

La señora Maria Zoila a sus 71 años aun trabaja con muchas ganas, estudió hasta segundo año D. secundaria y tiene 12 hijos en total pero sólo dos aun dependen D. ella. Vive en el Sector Campiña D. Moche del Distrito D. Moche D. la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad. Se dedica a la preparación D. dulces como choco tejas, choco maní, etc., los cuales los venD. en Moche, Las Delicias y Trujillo. La señora Maria Zoila es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” en este grupo obtiene su primer crédito D. S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró cobertura D. chocolate y frutas secas e inició sola la producción debido a que antes pertenecía a una red D. dulcerías Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará mayor cantidad D. moldes, una caja D. leche, cobertura D. chocolate y frutas secas. La señora María Zoila sueña con tener una dulcería en la ciudad D. Trujillo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO MAKE THE SWEETS AND CHOCOLATES SHE SELLS.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María Elizabeth studied through fourth grade. She has a total of 6 kids, but only 2 still depend on her. She lives in el Balneario de Las Delicias in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. She is a woman who doesn't tire: she starts working very early and makes the most of every day. Previously, she was a housewife, but she had problems with her husband and saw the need to work to be able to take good care of her children.

Three years ago, she started selling desserts every afternoon by traveling the streets of Las Delicias. Later, she built a stand at the entrance of her house to sell fish and seafood. Currently, she sells food all day: she prepares breakfast very early, she sells lunch at midday and attends to construction workers, and starting at 4:00 in the afternoon, she sells desserts by traveling the streets of Las Delicias.

When she started her business of selling desserts, her first credit that she received in her interim group "Las Sirenas Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Mermaids) helped her a lot. She bought disposable glasses and spoons, chuño (potato flour), 10 kilograms of sugar, fruits, etc. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy stereo equipment to be able to play music at the stand where she sells food. Her biggest dream is to have a bar and restaurant in downtown Las Delicias, where there is the most activity.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria Elizabeth estudió hasta cuarto grado de primaria, tiene un total de 6 hijos pero 2 dependen de ella, vive en el Balneario de Las Delicias del Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Es una mujer que no se cansa, trabaja desde muy temprano y aprovecha el día al máximo. Anteriormente se dedicaba sólo a los quehaceres del hogar pero tuvo problemas con su esposo y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Hace tres años empezó vendiendo postres todas las tardes recorriendo las calles de Las Delicias, después construyó una ramada en la puerta de su casa para vender pescados y mariscos. Actualmente vende comida todo el día: prepara desayunos muy temprano al medio día vende almuerzos y atiende a obreros de construcción y a partir de las cuatro de la tarde recorre todas las calles de Las Delicias vendiendo postres.

Cuando inició su negocio con la venta de postres le fue de mucha utilidad el primer crédito que recibió en su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Sirenas Emprendedoras” de S/.300.00, con los cuales compró vasos descartables, cucharas, chuño, 10 Kg. de azúcar, frutas, etc. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará un equipo de sonido para poner música de fondo en la ramada donde vende comida. Su mayor sueño es tener un bar restaurante en el centro de Las Delicias donde hay mayor movimiento.

loans.use: Purchase of stereo equipment for her business

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther is 53 years old and lives in the area called Campina D. Moche in Trujillo. She prepares and sells meals on Saturdays and Sundays in a restaurant called El Zorro. The weekends are key for a good business here, as the town is a main tourist destination. Local people also know Campina D. Moche for its good food, so many families come for lunch on the weekends. She specializes in local dishes such as guinea pig, serrano ham, and a typical potato dish. Maria Esther is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante (always forward) from whom she received her first loan to buy rice, oil and other necessities. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will make necessary repairs to the restaurant so it's more comfortable for her customers.

La señora Maria Esther tiene 53 años D. edad y vive en el Sector Campiña D. Moche del Distrito D. Moche D. la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad. Ella venD. comida los sábados y domingos en el restaurante “El Zorro” ya que estos días son claves para un buen negocio porque la Campiña D. Moche es un lugar turístico cercano a las Huacas del Sol y La Luna, esta zona es visitada por los turistas generalmente los fines D. semana además la gente sabe que en la Campiña D. Moche se come muy bien y hay muchas familias que van a pasear y comer a esa zona los fines D. semana. Se ha especializado en la preparación D. cuyes, jamón serrano y papa a la huancaina (comidas propias D. la zona). La señora María Esther es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 con este dinero compró un saco D. arroz, un bidón D. aceite y menestras. Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, lo empleará para arreglar su restaurante y hacerlo más acogedor.

loans.use: TO MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS TO HER RESTAURANT SO IT'S MORE COMFORTABLE FOR THE CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Mariluz Rosa

texts.es:
Mariluz Rosa is 38 years old and has 4 children who depend on her. She has a small business making dairy products which are in great demand in the towns of Trujillo and Moche. She will open a new location in the Talara market soon, and is just waiting for the certificate of sanitation which allows her to distribute her products without any problems. She tells us it's in process. Mariluz studied as an executive secretary, but she did not finish her studies because she had the opportunity to take courses to learn how to prepare dairy products. This course allowed her to start her own business. She is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante, (always forward), from whom she received her first loan to buy necessary ingredients. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase vitamins for her two cows, and bottles for the yogurt. Her dream is to have an exclusive area set aside where she can prepare her dairy products without inconveniencing her family.

La señora Mariluz Rosa tiene 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella, tiene 38 años y es toda una microempresaria, ella elabora productos lácteos (yogurt, queso, manjar blanco, toffes, chocolates, etc.), tiene muchos pedidos en Trujillo, Moche y ahora esta abriendo mercado por Talara, hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien en su negocio, solo le falta el Carnet de sanidad (permiso) que certifica que puede distribuirlo sin ningún problema, pero nos comenta que ya está en trámite. La señora Mariluz estudió secretariado ejecutivo pero no pudo terminar los estudios porque cuanto estaba en el último ciclo viajó a su ciudad natal en Junín. Tuvo la oportunidad de recibir cursos sobre preparación de productos lácteos los que le sirvieron para iniciar su negocio Es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 solees con los cuales compró cobertura, fruta seca y azúcar (insumos). Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará vitaminas para las dos vacas que tiene y envases para el yogur. Su mayor sueño es tener un área exclusiva donde elaborar sus productos sin incomodar a su familia.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VITAMINS FOR HER TWO COWS AND BOTTLES FOR THE YOGURT SHE PREPARES.

loans.name: Nancy Amada

texts.es:
Nancy Amada is 42 years old and has 3 children who depend on her. They live in the sector called Campina de Moche, in the province of Trujillo. Nancy makes dairy products such as yogurt and cheese, and brings them to Trujillo to sell. She also sells her products to friends and former colleagues. She is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante, (always forward) from whom she received her first loan to buy ingredients needed to make her products. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase a small cow, which little by little, with care and feeding, will begin to produce milk. This will be much more cost effective than buying the milk, which is expensive and takes much of her profits. Her dream is to be known for the quality of her products, and that her business continues to grow every day.

La señora Nancy Amada tiene 42 años de edad, con grado de instrucción superior técnica y 3 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Sector Campiña de Moche del Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Ella elabora productos lácteos tales como yogurt, manjar blanco, quesos, etc. Y los lleva a vender a Trujillo, vende también a sus amistades y a algunos ex compañeros de trabajo. La señora Nancy es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” en este grupo obtuvo su primer crédito de S/ 300.00 soles, este dinero le permitió producir en mayor cantidad y con el compró cultivos para preparar yogurt, leche y coladores para preparar quesos. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 soles, que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará una vaquita (vaca pequeña) que poco a poco, con la alimentación, estará apta para dar leche, ya que comprar la leche resulta muy costoso y no queda mucha ganancia. Su mayor sueño es hacerse conocida por la calidad de sus productos y que de ese modo su negocio crezca cada vez más.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A SMALL DAIRY COW, INCREASING HER PROFITS AND GROWING HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Natalia Maria

texts.es:
Natalia Maria is 46 years old and completed some of her education. She has 5 children but only 2 of them still depend on her. They live in the district of Moche in the Trujillo province. Natalia has a business from her home, preparing and selling breakfasts and set lunches, as well as sodas and beers. She began by selling typical potato dishes, but her clients suggested she add other items to the menu. She is part of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante, (always forward), from whom she received her first loan to set up a small kitchen where she could prepare and serve her meals. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will fix her refrigerator, and buy 3 tables and chairs to improve her business. Her dream is to modernize her restaurant.

La señora Natalia María tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene 5 hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Natalia tiene su negocio instalado en su domicilio, prepara desayunos, almuerzos (menú), vende cerveza y bebidas gaseosas. Ella se inició vendiendo papa a la huancaína (comida típica) pero sus propios clientes le sugirieron que preparará otros platos y así empezó a variar el menú. La señora Natalia ingresa al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” invitada por una vecina en este grupo obtiene su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró una cocina pequeña y platos. Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, arreglará su refrigeradora y comprará tres mesas y banquitos (asientos) para mejorar su negocio. La señora Natalia sueña con modernizar su restaurante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TABLES AND CHAIRS FOR THE SMALL RESTAURANT SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME, AS WELL AS REPAIR HER REFRIGERATOR.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. Rocío del Pilar is 36 years old, completed secondary school, and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo, La Libertad. She has three children, but only two are dependent on her. She entered the interim group “Las Sirenas Emprendedoras” (The Enterprising Sirens) through her neighbor that invited her to join the group. She received her first loan for S/.300.00, and used it to buy fabric, thread, buttons, trimmings, etc, for making clothing and costumes. Then she devoted herself to sewing costumes for rent, and also to sewing all types of clothing, according to the requests of her customers. With this loan for $250, which she will pay in four months, she will buy fabric, thread, closures, magazines to create masks of famous people, and some dresses that have been ordered for proms. Her greatest dream is to expand her business and have all the machinery she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rocío del Pilar tiene 36 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, vive en el Balneario de Las Delicias distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 3 hijos. pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Ingresó al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Sirenas Emprendedoras” por medio de su vecina que le invitó a formar parte de este grupo; obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró telas, hilos, botones, adornos, etc. para la confección de ropa y disfraces; pues ella se dedica a confeccionar disfraces para alquilarlos y también confecciona ropa de todo tipo según pedido de sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/.700.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará telas, hilos, cierres, botones y revistas para confeccionar disfraces de personajes de moda y también algunos vestidos ya que tiene pedido para fiestas de promoción. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener toda la maquinaria necesaria.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her clothing production

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa Jesús is 40 years old and only finished elementary school. She has 6 children that depend on her. She lives in the Moche district in the province of Trujillo of the county of La Libertad. For over 20 years, she’s dedicated herself to chicken sales in different supermarkets, in addition to distributing the chicken, she also sells them in the Moche market. She buys the chickens wholesale, kills them, and sells them according to her clients pending orders: whole chickens, legs, breasts, feet, gizzards etc.

Mrs. Teresa is a member of the group Mientras Tanto “Senor de la Piedad” (In the meantime “ Lord of Mercy”), in this group she obtained her first loan of approximately US $100 which used to buy a larger quantity of chicken.

With this loan of US $350, which she’ll pay back in 4 months, she’ll buy chicken wholesale as she’ll have high product demands due to the end of year festivities.

Her biggest dream is to have a large and well established restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa Jesús tiene 40 años de edad, estudió solo primaria completa y tiene 6 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a la venta de pollo (aves de consumo) por uno y otro mercado, actualmente, además de distribuir el pollo, vende en el mercado de Moche; compra el pollo al por mayor (por javas) los sacrifica y vende de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes: pollo entero, piernas, pechugas, patas, menudencia etc.

La señora Teresa es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Señor de la Piedad” en este grupo obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró mayor cantidad de pollo.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará pollos al por mayor debido a que tendrá mayor demanda en estas fiestas de fin de año.

Su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante grande y bien implementado.

loans.use: To buy chicken to meet the demand for the end of the year festivities.

loans.name: Valeria Estaurofila

texts.es:
Mrs. Valeria is 52 years old and finished elementary school. She has 2 children but only 1 depends on her. Mrs. Valeria lives in the Alto Moche district in the Trujillo province in the department of La Libertad. She earns a living preparing foods to serve in all sorts of events that occur in her town and district. She also serves lunch to the workers of a social program and makes fleece overalls (appropriate winter material) that she sends to different places in the sierra. Mrs. Valeria is a member of the group Mientras Tanto “Los Jazmines” due to a friend that asked her to be a part of the group; she obtained her first loan of approximately $100 which she used to buy fowls such as ducks , hens, and roosters for her food preparation. With this loan of US $150, which she’ll pay back in 4 months, she’ll buy more fleece, oil for her sewing machines, and elastic to make overalls for an order she received. Her biggest dream is to have a factory with modern machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West , Kiva volunteer.

La señora Valeria tiene 52 años de edad, estudió primaria completa. Tiene 2 hijos pero solo 1 depende de ella. La señora Valeria vive en el sector Alto Moche distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a preparar comida para servir en eventos de todo tipo que se realizan en su zona y en todo su distrito, actualmente también está atendiendo con almuerzos a trabajadores de un programa social, además confecciona buzos de polar (material apropiado para invierno) los cuales los envía a diferentes lugares de la sierra de la región La señora Valeria se integra al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Los Jazmines” por medio de una amiga que le invito a formar parte de este grupo; obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró aves como patos, pollos y gallinas para la preparación de comida. Con este préstamo de S/.400.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará tela polar, aceite para sus máquinas de coser y elástico para confeccionar buzos para un pedido que acaba de recibir. Su mayor sueño es poner un taller de confecciones con maquinaria moderna.

loans.use: To buy cloth and consummables for the making of clothing.

loans.name: Vilma Frecia

texts.es:
Mrs. Vilma Frecia is 57 years old and lives in the Salaverry District, in the province of Trujillo, depart of La Libertad. She studied in a technical field but due to personal reasons chose not to follow that path. She has 4 children but none of them depend on her. A while ago she moved to Argentina to work because she had many needs and couldn’t find work here. With the money she saved she opened a small store in her home.

Her mother-in-law invited her to be a member of the communal bank JERID – On the way to Success, and through them obtained her first loan of approximately US $100 which she used with her savings to buy groceries and shelves to display her products.

With this loan of US $350, which she’ll pay back in 4 months, she’ll buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, eggs and panetones (traditional holiday bread) that she’ll sell during this holiday season.

Mrs. Vilma dreams of returning to Argentina and starting a business there.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vilma Frecia tiene 57 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Salaverry, Provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad. Estudió una carreta técnica pero no la ejerció por motivos personales. Tiene 4 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Hace un tiempo atrás viajó a Argentina a trabajar porque tenía muchas necesidades y acá no conseguía trabajo, con el dinero que ahorró puso una pequeña bodega en su casa.

Su suegra le invitó a ingresar al Banco Comunal JERID – Camino al Éxito y en este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00, con este dinero completó los ahorros que tenía para comprar abarrotes y andamios para exhibir sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000 soles, que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, huevos y también panteones que venderá en la campaña navideña.

La señora Vilma sueña con regresa a Argentina y poner allá un negocio.

loans.use: To buy products to sell during the end of the year festivities.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María Victoria A. is a member of the community bank Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women). She lives in Manuel del Águila street in the district and province of Moyobamba in the region of San Martín. She has a sales stall in the central market of the city where she sells products including green and ripe bananas, a variety of beans, casava (yuca), corn flour, starch, etc. She decided to start her business because she needed to generate her own income in order to support her children. Despite having no education whatsoever, she launched this business on her own. In the beginning she had the support of the mother-in-law of one of her children. She didn't know how to buy or sell, but little by little she went along learning. Now she does both very well. She is a very hard-working and capable person.

This loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, will buy products including beans of different varieties in sacks, bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, sacks of starch, corn flour, also in sacks, aguajina (a fruit juice made from aguaje, a jungle fruit) and fruits and vegetables. This will allow to to stock her sales stall well while at the same time keeping her clients well satisfied.

She is 56 years old with 12 children, now all adults. Her husband supports her in the business and is happy about the the success she has achieved. Starting the business improved her self esteem. She learned how to manage the business, her clientele grew and the business helped to improve her economic situation, giving her the means with which to provide an education to her children. Her goal is to continue in this business, have it well stocked, and continue improving it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran. Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Victoria A. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, vive en el Jr. Manuel del Águila s/n del distrito y provincia de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad donde vende productos de pan llevar como plátanos verde y maduros, diversos tipos de frijoles, yuca, harina de maíz, almidón, etc. Decidió iniciar un negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos, a pesar de no contar con ningún tipo de educación ella emprendió esta actividad. Al inicio tuvo el apoyo de su consuegra porque ella no sabia comprar ni pagar y poco a poco fue aprendiendo, ahora lo hace bastante bien. Es una persona muy trabajadora y hábil.

El préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cuál pagará en 6 meses, comprará sus productos como frijoles en sacos de diferentes variedades, plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, almidón en sacos, harina de maíz, también en sacos, aguajina y frutas y verduras, de esa manera tener bien surtido su puesto de venta y a la vez también tener bien satisfechos a sus clientes.

Tiene 56 años y 12 hijos, pero ya todos son mayores de edad. Su esposo la apoya en su negocio y está contenta por sus logros obtenidos, mejoró su autoestima, aprendió el manejo del negocio, su clientela aumentó, ello también ayudó a que mejore su situación económica y así contar con los medios necesarios para poder brindarle educación a sus hijos. Su meta es continuar con este negocio, tenerlo bien surtido y mejorarlo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: beans, bananas, cassava (yuca), etc.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Maria Regina is a partner of the La Amistad Communal Bank and lives in the district and province of Moyobamba in San Martin. She has a stand in the city’s central market where she sells provisions. She decided to start this business because she needed to generate her own income to maintain her children, and knowing her sales abilities in other types of business, she saw that this activity was more profitable and less tiring than the previous ones.

The loan of S/. 1,100.00, which she will repay in 6 months, will buy her different products like bananas in bunches, cassavas, oranges and lemons in sacks, fruits, vegetables and bottled honey, and with that she will have her stand well-stocked and will satisfy her clients’ needs.

Maria Regina is 55 years old and is separated from her husband. She has four children, two of them still very young. She is an optimistic, responsible and entrepreneurial woman, and she wishes to have another stand in that market for the sale of prepared food.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Regina es socia del banco comunal La Amistad, vive en del distrito y provincia de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad donde vende productos de pan llevar o de primera necesidad. Decidió iniciar este negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos y conocedora de sus habilidades como comerciante en otros tipos de negocio vio que esta actividad era más rentable y descansado que los anteriores.

El préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diferentes productos como plátanos en racimos, yucas, naranjas y limones en sacos, frutas , verduras y miel de abeja en botellas y con ello tener bien surtido su puesto de venta y de esa manera poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes.

Tiene 55 años, separada de su esposo, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos aún pequeños. Es una mujer optimista, responsable y emprendedora, la cual anhela tener otro puesto en el mercado para la venta de comida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (bananas, cassavas, oranges, lemons, fruits, vegetables, honey, etc)

loans.name: Lourdes Judith

texts.es:
Lourdes belongs to the La Amistad del Dorado Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Moyabamba. She conducts business in a sales stand in the city’s supply market where her patrons, who are dwellers from the area or nearby visitors, attend daily.

Ever since she was a little girl, she had experience selling food with her mother, for which reason she had no difficulty starting her own business with the help of her husband and oldest daughter. The great service she offers her clients and her excellent flavoring has caused her clientele to grow, and she feels very satisfied from it.

With the loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase the necessary equipment for the installation of her water and drainage services, and she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals such as rice; sugar; legumes in wholesale; vegetables of all varieties (by the kilogram); and beef, chicken, pork and fish, also by the kilogram, which will allow her to prepare diverse meals for her clients.

Lourdes is a happy and enthusiastic woman of 35 years of age. She wishes to create a better future and live to old age in tranquility. For that reason, she wishes to one day own a room rental business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal La Amistad del Dorado, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Desarrolla su negocio en un puesto D. ventas del mercado D. abasto D. esta ciudad donD. diariamente acuden sus comensales, los cuales son moradores D. la propia localidad o visitantes D. lugares cercanos.

DesD. pequeña tuvo experiencia en la venta D. comida junto a su mamá, por lo que no le fue difícil instalar su propio negocio con la ayuda D. su esposo y una hija mayor. La buena atención que brinda a sus clientes y su buena sazón hace que cada día su clientela aumente, con lo que se siente muy satisfecha.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará los accesorios necesarios para la instalación D. los servicios D. agua y desagüe y comprará los insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades (por kilos), carnes D. res, pollo, cerdo y pescado, también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada a sus clientes.

Lourdes es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con 35 años D. edad, la cual desea forjarse un futuro mejor y una vejez tranquila, es por ello que anhela tener un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones.

loans.use: Purchase the necessary equipment for the installation of water and drainage services, and ingredients for the preparation of her meals such as rice, sugar, legumes, vegetables of all varieties, beef, chicken, pork and fish.

loans.name: Lindomera Esterfilia

texts.es:
Lindomira is a member of the community bank La Amistad. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Moyabambo. She runs her business out of her house, selling charcoal made from mezquite and other local trees (chupetes) wholesale and retail.

The loans she has received from the community bank along with a little money of her own gave her the opportunity to increase her sales of mezquite charcoal. She carries the charcoal directly from the city of Chiclayo and sells it to the roasted chicken restaurants, Peruvian grilled brochette restaurants, meat barbeque restaurants and other businesses in the community.

With this loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy mezquite charcoal in sacks, which is a very high quality product in high demand by the businesses in her area selling grilled chicken and grilled meats.

Lindomira is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and their two young children. Lindomira is very young and optimistic. She longs to someday open a video game center in her house ,as well, to offer entertainment to the people of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lindomira pertenece al Banco Comunal La Amistad, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa y se dedica a la venta al por mayor y menor de carbón de algarrobo y chupetes.

Con los préstamos otorgados por el Banco Comunal y al contar con un capital propio le dio la oportunidad de incrementar la comercialización de carbón de algarrobo que trae directamente desde la ciudad de Chiclayo y los vende a las pollerías, anticucherías, a las que realizan parilladas y a otros negocios que se desarrollan en la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará carbón de algarrobo en sacos, producto de muy buena calidad y que es muy requerido por todos aquellos negocios de la localidad que se dedican a la venta de pollos a la brasa y parrillas diversas de carnes.

La señora Lindomira tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos, mujer joven y optimista, anhela instalar también en su casa una red de videos de juegos recreativos y brindar diversión a los pobladores de su barrio.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale wholesale and retail

loans.name: Geraldina

texts.es:
Señora Geraldina belongs to the interim group "Las Orquídeas" (The Orchids). She lives in the region and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. Her business is located in her home at 294 Jr. Juan D. la Riva, and she makes a living by selling groceries, fruits and vegatables retail.

She is a woman who, thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos, has managed to grow her business. She shares the responsibilities of her home with her husband, and she will use this loan to buy groceries in larger quantities and sell them to her clients as they need them.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar (in sacks), milk in boxes, eggs in cartons, and other products like candies and jewellery (rings, earrings, etc.), which sell well in her business.

Señora Geraldina is 57-years-old, and she lives with her husband and 4 children. She thanks Manuela Ramos for the loans that they offer her because it lets her buy groceries in larger quantities and to increase the amount of products that her clients request of her. In the near future, she will use the savings from her business to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Geraldina pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Juan D. la Riva Nº 294 y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, frutas y verduras al por menor.

Es una mujer que gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos ha logrado incrementar su negocio. En el hogar comparten responsabilidades con su esposo y el préstamo lo utiliza en la compra abarrotes en mayor cantidad y surtirlos D. acuerdo a la necesidad D. los clientes.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar (en sacos), leche en cajas, huevos en jabas y otros productos como golosinas, pasamanería (anillos, aretes, etc), los cuales tienen buen movimiento en el negocio.

La señora Geraldina tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el préstamos que le brinda, el cual le permite comprar los abarrotes en mayor cantidad y aumentar productos que los clientes solicitan. En un futuro cercano con los ahorros que acumule en su negocio piensa terminar D. construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
Exilda is a member of Banco Comunal "Santa Ana", which is located in the province and district of Moyabamba, San Martin department. She sells goods, fruits and vegetables. Her stand is located in a kiosk which she has in front of her house.

The loan of $675, which she plans on repaying within 6 months will help in the purchase of rice, bags of sugar, gallons of different brands of oils, toilet paper in bulk, canned fish, soaps and boxes of soap, sodas in small packages, and wide varieties of fruits and vegetables so that her clients can find everything they need.

She is 61 years old, she is married and has 6 self-supporting children. She considers herself independent enough to be able to make decisions and manage her business. Because of her charisma, she is able to get the attention of many clients. She treats them with the respect they deserve and is able to offer many things in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Translator.

La señora Exilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Ana“, ubicado en la provincia y distrito de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, su local está instalado en un kiosco acondicionado en el frontis de su propia casa. El préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros de diferentes marcas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado en latas, jaboncillos y jabones en cajas, refrescos en cajitas pequeñas, frutas y verduras diversas en kilos para así tener bien surtido el negocio y los clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. Tiene 61 años de edad, es casada con 6 hijos, todos independientes. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes, además de atenderlas con cordialidad y de tener un negocio surtido.

loans.use: Purchase of goods ( rice, sugar, oil, etc.) Purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Señora Estela is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the region of San Martín in the province and district of Moyobamba. Her business is located in the wholesale foods market in her city. She makes a living by selling cured beef, chorizo (a pork sausage), chicarrón (another type of sausage), and their derivatives. For 35 years, she has been known for offering a very high-quality product, which has let her earn a good clientele.

With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy live pigs to be sacrificed, processed, and made into dry meat and sausages to serve as inputs for the preparation of typical dishes of the region.

Señora Estela is 62-years-old. She has a husband and 5 children who are all independent, and who are her principal source of help in her business. She likes the work that she does and hopes to continue doing it because it supports her and lets her live peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Estela es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Ana, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, se dedica a la venta de cecina, chorizo, chicharrón y sus derivados. Desde hace 35 años es muy conocida por brindar un producto de muy buena calidad, lo que le ha servido para ganarse una buena clientela.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará cerdos vivos para ser sacrificados, procesados y convertirlos en carne seca y embutidos y servir de insumos para la preparación de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Estela tiene 62 años, esposo y 5 hijos, todos ellos independientes y son su principal ayuda en el negocio. Le gusta el trabajo que hace y desea continuar realizándolo porque le mantiene en actividad y le permite vivir con tranquilidad.

loans.use: Purchase of animals (pigs)

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Mrs. Maricela lives in the area of San Martin, province and district of Lamas. She is a member of the Community Bank Las Lameñas. She currently manages a food business from her own house, located at Jr. San Martín Nº 600. She adapted the place where her customers come to eat everyday. She is a single mother and has two daughters that help her with the business. With the experience acquired selling cold and grilled items and after many customer requests, she decided to venture into preparing a whole menu of meals. For the last six months she has been able to attract many clients, thanks to the good service as well as the delicious meals. With a loan for S/ 1,000.00, to be paid in 6 months, she will buy a microwave for warming up snacks and food. She will also renovate her cooking utensils such us pots, dishes, glasses, silverware. This will offer a better presentation and service to her customers. Maricela is a young and enthusiastic 35 year old. She wishes to provide a better future for her daughters and is why she would like to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maricela vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas. Es socia del Banco Comunal Las Lameñas y actualmente vende comida en su propia casa, la cual está ubicada en el Jr. San Martín Nº 600, lugar donde acondicionó un ambiente al que diariamente acuden su comensales. Es madre soltera, tiene dos niñas quienes la ayudan en el negocio. Con la experiencia que tiene en la venta de refrigerios y parrillas y ante el pedido de sus clientes decidió también trabajar en la preparación de comidas tipo menú y desde hace 6 meses ha ido logrando fidelizar muchos clientes, tanto por su buen trato como por su rica sazón. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, pagará en 6 meses, comprará un horno microondas para calentar los refrigerios y platos de comida, así mismo renovará sus utensilios de cocina como ollas, vajillas, platos, vasos, cubiertos, los cuales les permitirá una mejor presentación y atención a sus clientes. Mariela es joven y entusiasta y tiene 35 años. Desea darle a sus hijas un futuro mejor por lo que anhela ampliar su negocio con la venta de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of assets (microwave, plates, kitchen utensils)

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
Grimanesa is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Moyabamba. Her business is situated in the local supply market. She sells cecina (a smoked cured meat), chorizo sausage and chicharrón (pork rind) and its derivatives. For 30 years now, thanks to the great flavoring, hygiene and customer service she offers, she counts with loyal clients not only from that zone, but also from other parts of the region.

With the loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her products like pork, which is her essential prime material, and the necessary condiments for the preparation of her smoked meats and sausages. She also sells raw red meat.

Grimanesa is 61 years old and the mother of 7 children, all independent now. The business she runs has turned her into an independent, perseverant, decisive and secure woman. She dreams of starting a business with sales associates of red meats and its derivatives.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Grimanesa es socia del Banco Comunal “ Santa Ana”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de abastos de la localidad.
