La competencia en ambas actividades es media ya que el mercado laboral ofrece personas que ofrecen este tipo de servicios a las instituciones privadas, por otra parte en el rubro de la sastrería la calidad de acabado final es lo que le distingue. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá una motocicleta para poder trasladarse con mayor rapidez, el costo de la misma fluctua entre los $us. 700.- a $us. 800.-. Sus antecedentes crediticios son muy buenos.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Before señora T. had her business, she worked as a maid. Since she was a single mother, had two school-aged children to care for, and was the only source of income for her family, she decided to go into business for herself with savings she had from her previous job. She started to sell fruits and vegetables on the outskirts of the market until she received her own stretch in La Estación market. She then started to sell cosmetics through the credits she received from Ceprodel (to date, she has received 15 credits).

She has done this work for 20 years, and has seen good results from these loans that have helped her improve the conditions of her location. She has also increased her working capital, and therefore, her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La sra T. antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada domestica, por ser madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar y siendo el único sostén de su familia decide trabajar por si sola con ahorros propios de su trabajo anterior. Inicia vendiendo frutas y verduras en orillas del mercado , hasta lograr obtener un tramo en el mercado La Estación donde es incrementado con venta de cosmético a través de los créditos obtenidos por ceprodel(actualmente ha realizado 15 créditos).

Durante veinte años ha mantenido esta actividad, obteniendo buenos resultado de estos prestamos que han venido a de mejorar las condiciones de su tramo ya que ha ido incrementando su capital de trabajo y por ende sus ganancias.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is 29 years old. She studied through secondary school. She has 2 children, both dependent on her. Currently Rosario lives in the district of Laredo, in the province of Trujillo and the department (region) of La Libertad. She works selling beauty products by catalog and selling clothing on credit. Her principal clients are the vendors of the Modelo market in Laredo, whom she has known for a long time; they are her loyal clients. It was some of these vendors from the Market who invited Rosario to invest in the commnity bank "Laredo". Through this community bank she obtained her first loan fo 300 soles (Peruvian currency) ,with which she bought beauty products for her inventory.

With this lnew oan of 1800 soles , which she will repay in full in 6 months, Rosario will buy clothing. She plans to sell the clothing during the holiday season at the end of the year and into the summer season. Her dream is to launch a large boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosario tiene 29 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Actualmente la señora Rosario vive en el distrito de Laredo provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y ropa al crédito y sus principales clientes son los vendedores del mercado “Modelo” de Laredo a los que conoce hace mucho tiempo y son sus clientes fieles. Justamente algunas de estas vendedoras del mercado fueron quienes la invitaron a ingresar la Banco Comunal “Laredo”, en este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 soles, con este dinero compró productos de belleza para tener en stock. Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 soles, que cancelará en seis meses, comprará ropa, la cual piensa vender en estas fiestas de fin de año e inicio de la temporada de verano. Su mayor sueño es poner una boutique grande.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Susana Deysi

texts.es:
Señora Susana is 28-years-old, and she finished high school. She has one small son who still depends on her. She lives in Poblado Menor Palermo in the district of Chao in the province of Virú in La Libertad. Since she was very young, her mother taught her to be responsible for taking care of animals, and this is how she learned to raise them. When she got married, she decided to make a living by raising animals like turkeys, pigs, ducks, and chickens to have her own income and not to depend only on her husband since he did temporary jobs.

Susana is a founding member of the interim group "Las Luchadoras" (The Fighters). She received her first credit of 200 soles from this group, which she used to buy food for her animals. With this credit of 700 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy young pigs to fatten and to sell later.

Susana is the secretary of the María Jesús Mothers Club, which provides breakfast and lunch to 52 senior citizens and 300 children in their community. She is also a promoter of health and is in charge of providing first aid and some medication to people in her town because the health center is far away, but she helps to transport sick people who need specialized care.

Susana's dream is to increase the quantity of animals she raises every year so she can have savings to give her son what he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Susana tiene 28 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 1 niño pequeño que depende de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor Palermo del Distrito de Chao de la Provincia de Virú del Departamento de La Libertad. Desde muy pequeña su mamá le enseñó a ser responsable de la crianza de unos cuantos animalitos y ahí aprendió como criarlos. Cuando se casó decidió dedicarse a la cría y venta de animales como: pavos, cerdos, patos y gallinas para tener un ingreso propio y no depender solo de su esposo ya que él tiene trabajos eventuales.

La señora Susana es socia fundadora del Grupo Mientas Tanto “Las Luchadoras”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.200.00 soles con los cuales compró alimento para sus animales. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 soles, que cancelará en cuatro cuotas, comprará cerditos (cerdos pequeños) para engordarlos y venderlos posteriormente.

La señora Susana es secretaria del Club de Madres “María Jesús” el cual beneficia con desayunos y almuerzos a 52 ancianos y 300 niños de su comunidad, además es promotora de salud encargada de brindar primeros auxilios y algunos medicamentos a los pobladores ya que el centro de salud está alejado, pero debe trasladar también a los enfermos que requieren atención especializada.

Su sueño es incrementar año a año la cantidad de animales que cría y tener ahorros para que pueda darle a su niño lo que necesita.

loans.use: Purchase of young pigs

loans.name: Teresa Teonila

texts.es:
Señora Teresa Teonila is 36-years-old, and she studied through high school. She has 2 children who still depend on her. She lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. Teresa has a beauty salon where she offers hair cuts, hair coloring, and manicures. In addition to this, she travels to Lima to buy clothing and gifts like: stuffed animals, picture frames, and albums, which her clients often ask for, and with time, she has been able to obtain.

She is a member of the Víctor Raúl Communal Bank. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy mirrors and chairs for her beauty salon. Previously, Teresa worked weaving sweaters, but thanks to the first credit she received from her communal bank, she started her busines.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will travel to the city of Lima to buy stuffed animals, decorations, watches, toys, etc. These products are in great demand because of the holidays. Teresa dreams about seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa Teonila tiene 36 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito El Porvenir de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Teresa tiene un salón de belleza en el que ofrece servicio de corte de pelo, tinte para el cabello, cuidado de manos y cutis; además de eso, viaja a Lima a comprar ropa y regalos como: peluches, portarretratos, álbum's los cuales muchas veces son pedidos de sus clientes que con el tiempo ha conseguido.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”, su primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300.00 lo utilizó para comprar espejos y sillones para su peluquería. Anteriormente la señora Teresa trabajaba tejiendo chompas, gracias al primer crédito que recibió en su banco comunal empezó su nuevo negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 soles, que pagará en cuatro meses, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar peluches, adornos, relojes, juguetes, etc., estos productos tienen gran demanda en estas fiestas de fin de año. La señora Teresa sueña con ver a sus hilos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of decorations, watches, toys, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lissette

texts.es:
Señora R. used to just attend to her house because of the difficult situation she was going through since she was unemployed. For this reason, she saw the need to help her husband with the education of their four kids and started selling miscellaneous products.

She started her business with $100 that her sister provided her as a loan. Her business is located in her home, which is favorable for her because she doesn't have to pay rent or taxes, and she also has a good influx of clients since her house is one block from La Estación market.

For a year and a half, señora R. has worked with the credits provided to her by Ceprodel, and she has managed to achieve favorable conditions for the sale of her products and to buy display cases, shelves, and a refrigerator. She has also been able to help better her family's quality of life and to help educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. R. anteriormente solamente se dedicaba a atender su hogar por la situación difícil que atravesaba ya que estaba sin empleo. Por esta razón se ve en la necesidad de apoyar a su compañero en la educación de sus cuatros hijos e inicia a vender productos misceláneos.

Inicia su negocio con U$ 100 que le es facilitado por su hermana en concepto de préstamo, el mismo es establecido en su casa lo cual le favorece su posición puesto que no tiene que alquilar ni pagar impuesto además de tener buena afluencia de cliente por encontrarse ubicado a una cuadra del mercado La Estación .

Durante año y medio la señora R. ha trabajado con los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel habiendo logrado alcanzar condiciones favorables para la venta de sus productos y compra de vitrinas, estantes y refrigerador sin olvidar la ayuda al mejoramiento de sus condiciones familiares y el apoyo a la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha L. rears about 400 layers (hens) and wants to take a loan to build another poultry house and put barbed wire around her home. She looks after 5 children and her old parents.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To construct a poultry house

loans.name: Catita Alvina

texts.es:
Señora Catita belongs to the communal bank "La Mujer Riojana" (The Riojan Woman), and she makes a living by selling juice and fruit and vegetable extract. Her business is located at 129 Mercado Central Puesto in the district and province of Rioja in San Martín. Because of her charisma and good treatment of her clients, they visit her everyday and also in the afternoons. For five years, she has sold juice and popsicles in her home located at 219 Jr. Julio C. Arana.

With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a refrigerator so she can keep her fruit fresh and always have supplies. She will also use this to refrigerate her popsicles, and she will buy fresh fruit that is in season every day.

Catita is the mother of 3 young children, and the oldest helps his siblings with their studies and expenses. She has always tried to help her children get ahead and to be a good example for them. Her perseverance and happiness have made her a great woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Catita pertenece al banco comunal La Mujer Riojana, se dedica a la venta de jugos y extractos de frutas y verduras, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central Puesto N° 129, distrito y provincia de Rioja, departamento de San Martín. Su carisma y buen trato hacia sus clientes ha permitido que ellos acudan diariamente, también por las tardes, desde hace cinco años, se dedica a la venta de refresco y chupetes en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Julio C. Arana 219.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará una refrigeradora para poder mantener la fruta fresca y así estar siempre abastecida y también lo utilizará para refrigerar los chupetes, también diariamente comprará fruta fresca y de estación.

Catita es madre de tres jóvenes y es el mayor de ellos el que le ayuda con los estudios y gastos de sus hermanos. Siempre se ha esforzado para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y ser un buen ejemplo para ellos. Su perseverancia y alegría han hecho en ella una gran mujer.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and fruit

loans.name: Sonia Isela

texts.es:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado" (Enterprising Women of the Market). She makes a living by selling breakfast. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz in Ancash. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of eggs, a box of coffee, tea, and mate (a South American tea). Sonia is 35-years-old, is married, and has 2 children, who are 5 and 3 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver, and both contribute to their family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de desayunos. Su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Central de Huaraz, del departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de 300.00 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, una caja de huevos, una caja de café, té y otros mates. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 5 y 3 años, su esposo es moto taxista (transportista), ambos contribuyen para los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. collects about 3 trays of eggs a day. She wants to take a loan to construct another poultry house, purchase feed, and bring in 100 more chicks. She had 6 children and looks after 2 orphans.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase poultry business

loans.name: Evelyn Karina

texts.es:
Evelyn is a partner/member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres Emprededoras del Mercado" of Huaraz. She sells red meat (cattle meat) and ready-made hamburgers. Her business is based in the central market of Huaraz, in the Ancash region. With this loan of 200.00 soles, which will be paid in 4 instalments, she will buy small tools to cut meat. Furthermore, she will buy hooked meat (half cattle meat/half wholesale) in order to sell to the retail market. She is 23 years old, is cohabiting and has a small 3 month-old child. Her partner works in the mines as a worker, and during his days off helps Evelyn with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva Translator

La señora Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprededoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de carne roja (carne de res) y hamburguesa preparadas, su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado central de Huaraz, del departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 200.00 soles, que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará una pequeña herramienta para trozar la carne, además comprará carne por gancho (media res/al por mayor) para vender al por menor. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño de 3 meses, su esposo trabaja en la mina como obrero y en sus días libres le apoya en el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale meat. To purchase cutting equipment.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
For years it has been the tradition of the family of Mrs. V. to make tamales. This business has been their means of sustenance amongst the scarcity of economic resources. She began the business with an initial investment of 500 córdobas that was obtained through a loan that was granted by a moneylender. She obtained an assigned food stand in the district at the edge of the market where she set up just a table with tamales and milk curd (cottage cheese).

Mrs. Velasquez continues to take out loans with Ceprodel. She didn't used to obtain much income for the sale of her tamales, but nowadays, with 13 granted loans, she feels very thankful to Ceprodel for helping her increase her investment capital in addition to allowing her to generate better earnings and better her quality of life - especially now that she's a single mother with 3 children and a grandchild in her care.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Por años ha sido tradición de la familia de la Sra. V. elaborar tamales siendo este negocio su medio de subsistir en su escasez de recursos económicos. Inicia con un capital de trabajo de quinientos córdobas que fue obtenido a través de un préstamo que se lo otorgo un prestamista, obtiene un puesto asignado por la intendencia a orillas del mercado donde solamente pone una mesa y coloca los tamales y la cuajada.

La señora V. decide realizar créditos en Ceprodel ya que no obtenía ganancias favorables por la venta de los tamales y hoy en día, con 13 créditos realizados se siente muy agradecida con Ceprodel por ayudar a incrementar su capital de trabajo además de generar mayor ganancia, y mejorar su nivel de vida ya que es madre soltera con tres hijos y un nieto a su cargo.

loans.use: Purchase basic ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Gemilda Arcelli

texts.es:
Gemilda is a member of the community bank La Mujer Riojana. She has an upholstery business on Tupac Amru Cdra Street in the town of Rioja in the province of Rioja in the San Martín region of Peru. She is the manager and owner of her business, with 2 of her children and several additional employees delivering the service under her direction.

With the loan of 3000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, Gemilda will buy leather coverings of different colors (6 bundles), a sewing machine for thick fabrics, 4 cans of glue, 4 spools of nylon thread, 2 pairs of steel scissors and other materials that her employees request of her.

With the support of her children Gemilda has been able to move her business ahead. She is always paying attention to the materials that she lacks and the people she needs to meet her orders, along with the quality of the final products, so that her clients will continue to recommend her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gemilda es socia del banco comunal La Mujer Riojana, tiene un negocio de tapizados en el Jr. Tupac Amaru Cdra 1 en la localidad de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, región San Martín en la cual es la administradora y propietaria, dos de sus hijos y personal a su cargo son los que brindan el servicio directo del negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará marroquines de distintos colores (06 fardos), una máquina de coser para tela gruesa, cuatro latas de pegamento, cuatro ovillos de hilo nylon, dos tijeras de acero y otros materiales necesarios que le vayan solicitando.

Con el apoyo de sus hijos ha podido sacar adelante su negocio. Siempre está pendiente de los materiales que faltan y del personal que necesite, también de los acabados de los trabajos para dar una mejor presentación y puedan seguir recomendándolos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for upholstery of furniture and purchase of assets (sewing machine)

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
Mrs.M. is a single mother who used to work with her sister preparing tortillas. After receiving her own home through a donation, she decided to start her own business preparing and selling tortillas. The money for the initial investment came from her savings and a small loan.

The tortillas are prepared in her home and marketed from a location near the market of La Estación. Mrs.M. has received 14 loans for working capital from Ceprodel which have helped her to maintain her home and raise her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susana Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. R. had to start her business to help the family increase their income. Her home was going through a difficult economic situation and she dedided to start a second hand clothes shop at the old train station.

With a big effort, she starts her business at the old train station with a small loan from her husband. Ceprodel has helped with 5 small loans which have aided Mrs.R. to grow the business. Profits are good and have helped her family´s financial situation thanks to the increased working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a partner of the Brigada Ramirez Communal Bank and sells prepared meals in her own establishment, situated in her home in Lamas in the San Martin region. The support of her family have helped her to better organize her business and in that way tend to her clients with much joy and charisma.

With the loan of S/. 2,500.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase more tables with their respective chairs (4 chairs for 1 table), decorative tablecloths (8 units) and she will have her locale painted so that it has a better presentation and is more appealing so that her clientele will enjoy a cool, comfortable and cozy environment.

Gloria is married and has two small children, a boy and a girl, who support her with some of the chores in their home and in the business such as the cleaning of the restaurant, washing of utensils, going to the market to do some shopping, and they sometimes tend to the clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria es socia del banco comunal Brigada Ramírez, se dedica a la venta de comida en un local propio ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Lima 617 de la localidad de Lamas, provincia de Lamas, región San Martín. El apoyo de su familia le ha permitido organizar mejor su negocio y de esa manera poder atender con mucho carisma y alegría a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará más mesas con sus sillas (04 mesas y 1 sillas), manteles decorativos (08 unidades) y mandar pintar el local para que se vea mejor presentado y más llamativo para que su clientela se sienta bien en un ambiente fresco, cómodo y acogedor. Es casada, tiene dos hijitos, un varón y una mujercita, los cuales la apoyan con algunas labores del hogar y del negocio como la limpieza del local, lavado de utensilios, ir al mercado a realizar algunas compras y algunas veces atienden al público.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and tablecloths as well as paint to implement her locale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a partner of the Doraditas en Accion Communal Bank and has a general store where she sells clothing for women and children, toys and footwear. Her store is situated on Calle Comercio (Commerce Street) in the province of El Dorado in San Martin. She started her business selling undergarments for men, women and children, then she expanded it little by little.

With the loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more toys of various models such as toy cars (20 units of various models), dolls (20 units), balls of different sizes and colors (12 units) and diverse games that will vary her stock.

Hilda considers herself very happy, charismatic and decisive in her business. She has three daughters, who help her make investment decisions in her business and with their household’s chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Doraditas en Acción, se dedica a la venta de mercería en general como prendas de vestir para damas, niños y niñas, juguetes y calzados. El local se encuentra ubicado en la Calle Comercio (frente al Mercado Central de la localidad de San José de Sisa), provincia de El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Empezó un negocio con la venta de ropas interiores para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, el cual fue ampliando poco a poco.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará más juguetes de variados modelos como carritos para niños (20 unidades de diferentes modelos), muñecas (20 unidades), pelotas de diferentes tamaños y colores (12 unidades) y diversos juegos que le permitan variar su stock. Hilda se considera muy alegre, carismática y decidida para los negocios, tiene tres hijas mujeres, las cuales la ayudan en la decisión de la inversión de su negocio y las labores del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase toys to vary her stock.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Before starting her own business, Mrs. Lorena worked as a housekeeper at her mother in laws´. However after separating from her partner, she decided to leave with her two small children. She obtained a small loan and began selling her products from a basket in a corner of La Estación market. As business was good, she decided to obtain a small stall in the market.

Mrs.Lorena obtained 17 loans from Ceprodel which have been put to good use helping her improve the stall and putting a roof on it. She is requesting this loan to construct concrete side walls which will prevent her product from being damaged in the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: María Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz, as her friends call her, is a member of the community bank La Mujer Riojana. She works selling prepared food, especially juanes (chicken, rice and/or other ingredients cooked inside a banana leaf) of all varieties, including rice with pork, rice with chicken, yuca (cassava) with pork, and yuca with chicken. She prepares her juanes in her sales stall located in the central market of the town of RIoja, in the province of Rioja and the region of San Martín. In a separate space located in the street Libertad la Cdra, she sells fast food at night, including salchipapas, sausages with french fries and salchipollo, a popular fast food chicken dish with fries, and hamburgers, etc.

With the loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, Emperatriz will buy 12 plastic chairs, 4 sets of matching tablecloths and napkins, a sack of rice, 10 chickens raised on small farms, a sack of potatoes, and whatever other items she'll need for the expansion of her business.

Her love for her children, her dedication to them and the effort she invests in being able to give them a good education have always been the impulse for her to continue working. Her friendliness and the good service she gives her clients have allowed her to be more creative in the varieties of juanes she prepares and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran. Kiva volunteer.

Emperatriz, como le llaman sus amigos, es socia del banco comunal La Mujer Riojana, se dedica a la venta de comida, especialmente juanes de todas sus variedades (de arroz con chancho, de arroz con gallina, de yuca con chancho, de yuca con gallina), ello lo elabora en su puesto ubicado en el Mercado Central de la localidad de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, región San Martín. En otro espacio ubicado Jr. Libertad la Cdra 8 vende comida rápida por las noches (salchipapas, salchipollo, hamburguesas, etc.)

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará sillas de plástico (12 unidades), cuatro juegos de manteles y servilletas, un saco de arroz, diez gallinas de chacra, un saco de papa y otras cositas más que pueda necesitar. Su amor, empeño y dedicación a sus hijos para poder darles una buena educación han sido siempre el impulso para seguir trabajando. Su cordialidad y buen trato a sus clientes le ha permitido ser más creativa en sus variedades de juanes.

loans.use: Purchase of assets for her business (plastic chairs, tablecloths and napkins). Also purchase of ingredients (rice, chicken, potatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Señora Maritza is a member of the Brigada Ramirez Community Bank. She is dedicated to the business of preparing and selling food from the different regions of her country. In that way she can satisfy the needs of her big clientele. Her business is located at the Central Market in the Lamas location (entering by Jr. Junin 2nd square), Lamas province, San Martin department. She has been in this business for 10 years.

With the 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy some kitchen equipment like: one pot, a dozen dishes, and a dozen glasses. She will also buy more wolesale groceries (a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, half box of milk and a 12kg noodle packet) and small farm hens. This provisions will allow her to reduce her expenses.

Maritza considers herself a happy and charismatic person with a lot of patience to serve her clients. Her good cooking and flavoring skills are the best assets of her business. She dreams with the possibility of having a bigger place so she can serve more people

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maritza es socia del banco comunal Brigada Ramírez, se dedica a la venta de comida de diferentes regiones del país para poder satisfacer a su amplia clientela, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central de la localidad de Lamas (ingresando por el Jr. Junín 2da. Cdra), provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará algunos artículos de cocina para renovarla, por ejemplo una olla, una docena de platos y una docena de vasos de vidrios, además comprará víveres en cantidad (un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, media caja de leche y un paquete de fideos de 12 kg) y gallinas de chacra, lo cual le permitirá reducir sus gastos. Maritza se considera una persona alegre, carismática y con mucha paciencia para atender a sus clientes y utiliza su buena sazón como la mejor carta de presentación del negocio. Sueña con poder tener un local más grande para poder atender a más personas.

loans.use: Buying kitchen equipment (pots, plates, glasses, etc).and buying groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc) and hens.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Since Mr. N. has known the craft of watchmaking/clockmaking, it has been his work. He worked out of his house, helping his wife with the household expenses, especially since she used to work at a company, earning a low salary. Unfortunately, destiny dealt Mr. N. a bad hand and he became widowed with two children and grandchildren in his care. In view of this situation, he decided to get a stand in the La Estación market. He did this to be able to obtain better wages, due to the fact that he only had a small customer base working out of his home, and make him confront the difficulty of his family situation.

He began the business in his home with savings from his job. To obtain the stand in the market, he asked for loans, which were granted to him. And nowadays, the stand is an enclosed booth that lends itself to the right conditions to be a successful operation.

With the loans obtained through Ceprodel, he has successfully improved his way of life, and is always continuing to move forward and get ahead for his family. In addition to increasing his business every day, he is currently beginning to sell phone cards and repair cell phones out of his stand, which is contributing to additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor N. desde que conoce el oficio de relojería se dedica a esta actividad en su casa, apoyando a su esposa en los gastos del hogar ya que trabajaba como en una empresa obteniendo bajo salario. Por cosas del destino el Sr. N. quedó viudo con dos hijos y nietos a su cargo, ante esta situación decide solicitar un tramo en el mercado La Estación para obtener mayor ingresos ya que en su casa la clientela era poca, para hacerle frente a la difícil situación de su familia.

Inicia el negocio en su hogar con ahorros de su trabajo y para acondicionar el tramo solicita créditos los cuales le han beneficiado por lo que actualmente el tramo es una caseta cerrada que presta las condiciones necesarias para la realización de esta actividad.

Con los créditos obtenidos por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida, salir siempre adelante con su familia además de incrementar cada día su negocio, actualmente esta iniciando en el mismo tramo venta de tarjeta y reparación de celulares lo cual es un ingreso mas que esta generando.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mery Antonieta

texts.es:
Señora Mery is a member of the Doradinas in Action Community Bank, located in the San Jose de Sisa district, province of El Dorado, San Martin region. She is dedicated to sell casual, sport, and elegant clothes for women, gentlemen, boys, and girls. Her shop is located on the main street in the San Jose de Sisa district at the Jr. Commerce Square (in front of the Central Market). She has been doing this business for 10 years, but before she used to do it door to door and also selling to friends and acquaintances.

With the 2,000.00 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will pay back in 4 months, Mery will buy more clothes, especially for girls and boys, approximately four dozen elegant dresses of different sizes to take advantage of the seasonal holiday parties, and elegant clothing pieces for women and men ( two dozen of different sizes and brands) so she can meet the demands of her loyal clientele.

Mery is 42 years old, married and only has two children, a boy and a girl. She feels very happy because she has always count with her husband's and her family's support, which in terms has allowed her to have a shop for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal Doradinas en Acción del distrito de San José de Sisa, provincia de El Dorado, región San Martín, se dedica a la venta de ropas de vestir casual, sport y elegante para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la localidad de San José de Sisa en el Jr. Comercio Cdra. 4 (frente al Mercado Central), se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, pero antes lo realizaba en forma ambulatoria y vendiendo a los amigos y conocidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará más prendas de vestir, principalmente para niñas y niños como cuatro docenas de vestidos elegantes de diferentes tallas para aprovechar la venta en las fiestas promocionales, prendas de vestir elegantes para damas y caballeros (dos docenas de diferentes marcas y tallas) para poder satisfacer a su asidua clientela. Mery tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene sólo dos hijos, un varón y una mujercita. Se siente muy feliz porque siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su esposo y familia, lo que le ha permitido poder adquirir un local.

loans.use: Buying clothes for selling.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Tudela

texts.es:
Tudela is a member of the Alto Mayo Community Bank, located in the district and province of Rioja, San Martin Department. She is dedicated to sell plastic flowers, living room decorations, plastic bags at wholesale as well as retail and also sells Christmas lights and ornaments. She has 12 years of experience doing this activity. Her business is located at the Central Market in the Rioja (precisely on the plastics and groceries aisle). She considers herself to be courteous towards her clients.

With the 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she promises to pay back in 6 months, Tudela will buy 50 different sets of Christmas lights that will allow her to have a variety and a supply for the end of the year celebrations. She will also buy 4 boxes of Christmas ornaments in different colors and sizes(little bells, balls, fruits, stars, candy canes, Papa Noel, and surprises), also Nativity sets (12 sets) and small Christmas trees (12 units), all of them at affordable prices for her customers.

Tudela is married with only one daughter. She has always enjoyed being in business and selling. Her mom taught her to work since young. That's why she has always been an independent person when it comes to the organization and investment on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Tudela es socia del banco comunal El Alto Mayo, provincia y distrito de Rioja, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la venta de flores plásticas, adornos para sala, bolsas plásticas al por mayor y menor y también a la venta de luces y arreglo navideños, ambas actividades desde hace 12 años. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central de la localidad de Rioja (sector plásticos y abarrotes), se considera muy atenta con los clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 50 juegos de luces de distintos modelos que le permitan surtir su negocio aprovechando las fiestas de fin de año, también cuatro cajas de adornos navideños de distintos tamaños y colores (bolitas, campanitas, estrellitas, frutas, bastones, papas Noel y sorpresas), además de nacimientos (12 juegos) y árboles pequeños (12 unidades), todos ellos al alcance de la economía de sus clientes. La señora Tudela es casada y sólo tiene una hija, siempre le gustó el negocio, su madre le enseñó a trabajar desde muy pequeña, es por ello que siempre fue independiente para la organización e inversión en su negocio.

loans.use: Buying Christmas merchandise like decorations, Nativity sets, and small Christmas trees.

loans.name: Mayra Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs.M. used to work as an operator in a local factory but did not earn enough to suport her family. She decided to open a small retail shop selling sandals and medicine. Being a single mother of two children with an aging mom to tend to forced her to make the decision to seek a small loan to begin selling her goods from a small table and a basket.

Currently Mrs. M. feels very fortunate to have received 18 loans from Ceprodel. These loans have provided her with the working capital to improve her family´s quality of life and to reduce the costs of purchasing the medicine which she is selling.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Working capital and stock purchase

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria H. is 31 years old and has two children, 14 and 12 years old. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, considered one of the poorest of Managua. She has worked as a elementary school teacher for three years. During that time, she has been able to improve her house, thanks to counting on the help of her husband in taking care of their children. She wants to provide better living conditions for her children, and amongst these conditions is her house. She needs to install a bathroom with a toilet, but she can't do everything at once. The money from this loan will be used to build a toilet (drain) and also to finish building a bedroom. Right now she and her two children sleep in the same room. She hopes to be able to keep her job and that way, be able to fix up her entire house.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria H. tiene 31 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, de 14 y 12 años respectivamente. Habita en el barrio Villa reconciliación, considerado uno de los barrios más pobres de Managua. Ella se desempeña como maestra de primaria, lleva tres años dedicándose a este trabajo, y desde ese tiempo para acá ha podido ir mejorando su casa, gracias a que cuenta con el apoyo de su marido en la manutención de sus hijos. Ella quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, y entre esas condiciones está su casa, necesita instalar un servicio higiénico, pero no puede hacerlo todo de una sola vez, por lo que el dinero de este crédito lo usará para construir el desagüe y también para terminar de construir un cuarto de habitación, ya que ella y sus dos hijos duermen en un mismo cuarto. Espera poder conservar su trabajo y así poder condicionar la vivienda en su totalidad.

loans.use: Build a toilet (drain) and buy cement and iron to finish building a room.

loans.name: Paula Azucena

texts.es:
Before Señora E. had her current business, she made candies. Nevertheless, because of the type of work, the income she made wasn't enough for her family to live on. Since she's a single mother with two kids to take care of, she took the initiative to search for another activity that would generate better profits for her.

She decided to become a member of Ceprodel two years ago, and she has received a lot of support from this instituton, having received 16 credits. This is why she started to sell cosmetics and candies as a street vendor, but this type of business wasn't working out for her. So, with her other loans, she requested a location in La Estación market, and established herself there doing what she does now, which is selling cosmetics.

Her business has increased from the loans she's received, and she has also been able to improve her quality of life and to achieve her objective, which was to obtain a location in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Señora E., antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a la producción de golosina. Sin embargo, por el tipo de trabajo los ingresos obtenidos no eran lo suficiente para subsistir con su familia ya que es madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo, por lo que toma la iniciativa de buscar otra actividad de negocio que le genere mayor ganancia.

Decide afiliarse con Ceprodel y hace dos años ha recibido mucho apoyo por parte de esta institución obteniendo así ayuda con 16 créditos a su favor. De esta manera inicia a vender sus cosméticos y golosinas de forma ambulante sin embargo, este tipo de negocio no le estaba resultando, por lo que con los otros prestamos solicitó un tramo en el mercado La Estación y se estableció quedándose al final en la actividad que realiza actualmente como es venta de cosmético.

El negocio ha incrementado con los créditos otorgados por la institución además de ayudarle a mejorar su nivel de vida y obtener su objetivo como lo era conseguir el local en el mercado.

loans.use: Acquisition of cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
Señora M. has spent the better part of her life just caring for her family and living off of her husband's income. However, after noticing that they were in a difficult economic situation, she decided to take out a loan to start a beauty salon in her home since she has skills in this trade. She started the salon in her home with her own savings and funds from Ceprodel. With this capital, she bought a mirror and scissors to offer services to her clientele, who are mainly merchants in La Estación market, since her house is very close to there.

Señora M. has benefited from five credits from Ceprodel, which she is thankful for because her business has grown quickly, and she has been able to improve her salon's conditions to offer good service to her clientele. She also is able to help her husband with the responsibilities of their home and raising their four kids.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Señora M., la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado solo a su familia viviendo de los ingresos del esposo sin embargo, al darse cuenta que la situación económica aun sigue difícil en el núcleo familiar decide realizar un préstamo para poner un salón de belleza en su hogar ya que ella presenta habilidades en este ramo. Inicia la actividad de belleza en su casa, con ahorros propios y parte con los obtenidos en Ceprodel. Al tener el capital, compra un espejo y algunas tijeras para brindar servicio a la clientela principalmente comerciantes del mercado La Estación por encontrarse su casa muy cerca de este lugar.

La señora M. ha sido beneficiada con cinco créditos por lo que declara que gracias a estos préstamos en Ceprodel el negocio ha incrementado rápidamente logrando tener mejores condiciones para brindar buen servicio a su clientela, además de ayudar al esposo con la responsabilidad del hogar y la formación de cuatro hijos.

loans.use: Working capital and construction of a beauty salon

loans.name: Isolina Benicia

texts.es:
Isolina has been in business selling refreshing shakes during the past 17 years. She started with a small loan from her oldest son. Her day begins at home where she blends the shakes to be sold at the Terminal market.

Her drink stand is very tidy and well located within the market. She is a widow and mother of 2 children that is struggling to help them improve their lives and aid their education.

Ceprodel has assisted Isolina financially during the past three years with 19 loans which have been repayed. The impact of these loans has been an improvement in her quality of life and an increase in the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lastenia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Sra. S. sells hardware, a business she started 5 years ago with savings of C$1,000. She sold her products in the La Estacion market at first, but then moved to the market at La Terminal where there were more potential customers and greater opportunities for sales. She has an excellent space inside the market, with a person responsible for security who she pays jointly with the other traders in her part of the market.

Sra. S. is married with 3 children who she struggles to educate so that they might be prepared for bright futures.

Ceprodel has provided Sra. S. with 22 loans over the last three years, funds that have given her peace of mind as her income from the business has grown.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de la señora S. se inicia con la venta de artículos ferreteros, teniendo 5 años de tener el negocio iniciando con un capital de C$1,000.00 producto de dinero que ahorro en su oportunidad de mas joven. Comienza vendiendo en el mercado la Estación para luego trasladarse al mercado La Terminal por haber mayor fluidez de clientes que le generan mayores ventas y desde luego mayores utilidades. Tiene un puesto fijo con óptimas condiciones dentro del mercado, dejando una persona encargada de seguridad que se paga en comunidad con otros ferreteros del sector.

Es casada con 3 hijos que viene luchando para educarlos para que sean personas preparadas en la vida.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace tres años con un total de 22 créditos otorgados y pagados en donde el impacto que han tenido es que se siente tranquila porque su negocio tiene buenos ingresos y se le ha han dado créditos para el mejoramiento de su familia y vivienda, teniéndole mucha confianza a su institución financiera.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: María Pastora

texts.es:
Sra. M. has a produce-selling business that she operates in the evenings because she spends days laundering clothes, all so that she can help to support her family. She started the business 5 years ago with a C$500 loan, selling in the La Terminal market. Though she has a spot inside the market, it's not a covered spot with walls or roof, and she's committed to finding a way to making it more secure by enclosing it.

Ceprodel has provided Sra. M. with 7 loans over the last year and a half, funds that are improving her and her family's quality of life. The loans are helping her improve her business and boost her competitive position in the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de la señora M. se inicia con venta de verduras que solo lo hace por la tarde ya que en el día se dedica a lavar ropa a domicilio para un mejor apoyo para su familia. Teniendo 5 años de tener el negocio e iniciando con un capital de C$ 500.00 producto de dinero prestado a un prestamista, comienza su negocio vendiendo en el mercado la Terminal teniendo su puesto de venta dentro del mercado sin embargo aun no esta cubierto con paredes y zinc por lo que uno de sus esfuerzos es buscar la manera de cubrir su local para mayor seguridad.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace año y medio con un total de 7 créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma en donde el impacto que han tenido es mejorando su nivel de vida al igual que su familia y mejorando sus ingresos con mayores ventas y utilidades convirtiéndola así en una potencial competidora e la venta de verduras en su municipio.

loans.use: Buy produce for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Nuestro Senor de Martha II ("Our Lord of Martha II") community bank. She earns a living making and selling "churros" (a cream-filled snack). Her business is located near Caraz in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With this loan of 1,800 soles, to be repaid in 8 months, she will buy 15 sacks of flour, a case of butter, a sack of bleached sugar and a bag of confectioner's sugar.

Maria, 37, has 6 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Her commitment and dedication have made her successful. She now has 6 carts from which she sells her products and she's created jobs for her relatives, as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestro Señor de Martha II”, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de churros (dulce relleno con crema de leche). Su negocio esta ubicado en el paradero a Caraz, en la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará 15 sacos de harina, una caja de manteca, un saco de azúcar rubia, una bolsa de azúcar impalpable.

La señora Maria tiene 37 años de edad y 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción (obrero). Su fuerza de trabajo y dedicación ha hecho de ella una mujer de éxito, porque hoy en día cuenta con 6 carritos en donde vende sus productos y también ha generado puestos de trabajo para sus familiares.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Noel Eusebio

texts.es:
Noel owns a bakery that supplies bread to local shops. He started the business 15 years ago with a C$10,000 loan from a micro-lender. He starts his day in the La Terminal market, selling bread made in an oven at his house. He and the 4 workers who help him make different kinds of bread. Before he started the business, he used to work with his parents helping them sell bread.

Ceprodel has provided 7 loans to Noel over the last year and 7 months, funds that have helped him improve his quality of life. They've helped him buy medication for his mother who suffers from cancer and improve his business.

Noel now has an established spot in the market with his own stand where he sells wholesale and retail supplies of bread . He's a single father with 1 son in college.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio del señor Noel inicia con una panadería el cual colocaba su pan en las pulperías. Actualmente tiene 15 años de tener el negocio el cual lo inicio con un capital de C$10.000.00 producto de un préstamo que hizo en una micro financiera. Inicia su trabajo vendiendo en el mercado la Terminal haciendo el pan en su casa en donde tiene el horno donde trabaja con 4 trabajadores que le apoyan en la elaboración del pan de diferentes tipos, antes de este negocio siempre trabajaba con sus padres ayudándoles a vender el pan.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace un año con 7 meses con un total de 7 créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma en donde el impacto que han tenido es mejorando su nivel de vida ayudándole a comprar el medicamento de su mamá que padece de cáncer (una enfermedad muy grave) y aumentando sus recurso económicos con mayores ventas y mayores inventarios.

Hoy en día el Señor Noel M. tiene un puesto fijo dentro del mercado con su estante propio en donde vende el pan al por mayor y al detalle. Es padre soltero con 1 hijo a su cargo que estudia en la universidad.

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the Senor de Ramos ("Lord of Ramos") community bank. She makes and sells fruity ice creams and yogurts in the city of Catac in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With this loan of 1,000 soles, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 10 cases of wafer cones, 1 sack of powdered milk, 1 sack of sugar and other ingredients for making ice cream.

Sara, 34, is the mother of 2 school-aged children. Her husband is her partner in the business and their children, too, help out with sales. They sell their products at local schools and other high-traffic areas.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de Ramos, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados de frutas y de yogurt en la ciudad de Catac, provincia de Recuay, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 10 cajas de barquillos, 1 saco de leche en polvo, y 1 saco de azúcar y otros ingredientes para la elaboración del helado.

La señora Sara tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de familia de 2 hijos que están estudiando en la secundaria, su esposo comparte el trabajo con ella, sus hijos colaboran también en la venta de sus productos, el lugar de venta es en los colegios y en los lugares de mayor movimiento.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela belongs to Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, she has a store which she runs from her home. This store is located in the Huaraz province, Ancash province.

WIth this loan, which will be cancelled in 6 months, she will buy items to buy her own supplies. Some of the supplies are: 2 boxes of breads, 2 boxes of milk, 10 boxes of soda, 1 bag of sugar, 1 bag of rice, 1 jug of oil, 3 boxes of oil, 1 box of tuna, 4 big bags of detergent with 60 units per box.

Adela is 40 years old, she has 2 kids who are 18 and 23 years old. She got her business started some 23 years ago and with her hard work has been able to make this a very successful store. Her husband is an electrician, they have both worked hard to give their children a good education. The oldest one just completed high school and their youngest attends college at Universidad Nacional Antunes de Mayolo.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Adela pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, ella cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su propia casa, ubicada en la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio: 2 cajas de panetones, 2 cajas de leche,10 cajas de gaseosas, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 lata de aceite, 3 cajas de aceite por litro, 1 caja de atún filete, 4 bolsas grandes de detergente de 60 unidades cada una. La Señora Adela tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 23 años. Ella empezó hace 23 años en su negocio y su empeño y esfuerzo han hecho que su negocio hoy en día sea prospero. Su esposo es electricista, ambos han trabajado bastante para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, el mayor de ellos ya terminó sus estudios superiores y la menor cursa estudios en la Universidad Nacional Antunes de Mayolo (UNASAM).

loans.use: Purchase of products for her mimi-mart store

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma is a member of the Community Bank Mujeres de Grandes Retos. She buys and sells baby animals (cuy, rabbit, chicken), and her business is located on Raymondi avenue in the city of Huarez, in the Ancash department of Peru.

With this loan fo 2000 soles, which will be paid back over the course of 4 months, she will buy 50 cuyes, 20 chickens and 20 rabbits

Emma is 45 years old, and is the mother of 4 children. Her oldest child is 23, and continues to study. Her other children are in primary school, and her husband works with the board. Both of them contribute to the household income.

Translated to English by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores (cuy, conejo, gallinas), su negocio esta ubicado en la avenida Raymondi de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo S/. 2,000.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 50 cuyes, 20 gallinas y 20 conejos. .

La señora Emma tiene 45 años y es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 23 años, cursa estudios superiores, los otros tres están en educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en el consejo en forma eventual y ambos contribuyen a los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: To purchase baby animals such as chickens and rabbits

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.es:
Amparo de Jesus G. is a very hard-working lady and her economic activity is the sale of fruit salads in the market at the main bus station in Leon, Nicaragua. Every day, to begin her work, Mrs. G. prepares bags of fruit to sell at her stand.

Mrs. G. has had her business for 10 years, which she started with savings she put together from her own efforts. Her business began on the corner where Iniser insurance company is, with a bench and a basket, selling candies in the open air. Later she started having a greater selection to sell, with soft drinks and fruit among other things; she was located on the same corner and put out her products in various baskets on a large wood table.

It is very important to note that Mrs. G. is a single mother who cares for two children who need her financial support, since they are in primary school and need to continue with their studies.

In order to maintain their economic situation, Mrs. G. has been working with Ceprodel for 2 years, and they have offered her financial help to grow her business by granting her 18 loans. Because of these loans, Mrs. G. has been able to get ahead to the point that she has been able to renovate her house while at the same time meet the needs of her children through her fruit-selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Amparo de Jesús Gonzáles es una dama muy trabajadora siendo su actividad económica la venta de ensaladas de frutas en el mercado de la Terminal de León en Nicaragua. Todos los días, al iniciar su labor la sra. Gonzáles prepara las bolsas de frutas para posteriormente venderlas en su localidad.

Actualmente la sra. Gonzáles tiene 10 años de tener su negocio e inició con el ahorro que había realizado propiamente con mucho esfuerzo. Su negocio comenzó en la esquina de la aseguradora Iniser con una banca y un canasto a la intemperie vendiendo caramelos, luego comenzó a surtir mas su venta invirtiendo en un poco la venta de gaseosas, frutas entre otros y actualmente se ubica en la misma esquina y sus productos los tiene en varios canastos todos sobre una mesa grande de madera.

Es de mucha importancia señalar que la sra. Gonzáles es madre soltera que tiene a su cargo a dos hijos el cual necesita apoyarlos financieramente ya que están estudiando en la primaria y además necesitan continuar con sus estudios.

Para poder sustentar su situación económica, la Sra. Gonzáles lleva 2 años de trabajar con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado ayuda financiera para crecer en su negocio otorgándole 18 créditos a lo largo de su labor. A raíz de haber realizado estos préstamos, la sra. Gonzáles ha podido salir adelante desde el punto de que ha podido remodelar su casita y a la vez suplir para la necesidad de sus hijos a los que tiene que mantener por medio de su negocio de venta de frutas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es:
Angel's activity is the purchase and sale of crafts in the city of Leon, Nicaragua. In order to sell crafts, Mrs. Lopez travels to the city of Masaya where she buys the products and later pays to transport them to Leon, where she has a small space from where she sells.

She started her business 30 years ago with her savings and an inheritance from her grandmother.

Her business began in Masaya, and later she moved to Leon, situating herself in the area around the main cathedral of Leon, spreading out her products on the ground. Later on she found a place in the central park. Before she had her own business, she helped her grandmother in the same type of work.

Angela is a single mother, and she stands out because of her efforts to prepare her 2 children for the future.

For the past two years she has received financial help from Ceprodel, which has been her helping hand with 13 loans. These have had an impact by allowing her to improve the appearance of her business and the conditions in which she lives, since the maintenance of her family and their education and health depend on the profits of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Ángela L. es a la compra y venta de artesanías en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Para poder realizar esta venta de artesanías como toda dama esforzada la sra. L. viaja hacia la ciudad de Masaya donde adquiere estos productos y posteriormente paga transporte para trasladar dichos productos a León que es donde los vende en un estante o espacio para colocarlos.

Inició su negocio hace 30 años con un monto que fue producto de ahorro y herencia de su abuela.

Su negocio comenzó en un tramo en Masaya y luego emigró a León ubicándose en la acera de la Catedral de la misma ciudad colocando sus productos en el suelo, luego consiguió un lugar en el parque central. Antes de tener este negocio le ayudaba a su abuela en este tipo de negocio hasta que se independizo.

La sra. Ángela L. es madre soltera, y se destaca por ser muy esforzada ya que tiene 2 hijos que los esta preparando para su futuro.

Recibió desde hace dos años ayuda financiera por parte de Ceprodel el cual ha sido su mano amiga con 13 créditos que le han impactado en haber mejorado la apariencia de su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que de sus utilidades ha dependido el sustento diario de su familia, educación y buena salud de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying her product offerings

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria's activity is the sale of food that she herself makes at home and later brings to the central market where she prepares a variety of dishes. She has had her business for 30 years, and she started it with her own savings from money that her mother gave her.

She began by selling food in the area outside the market, offering her meals at some benches set up in the open. Before this, she worked cutting cotton on farms that grew this product. Today Mrs. Membreno has a very comfortable stand with enough space so she can spread out her wares and sell her food.

She is a single mother who for many years has fought hard to educate her two children who are in primary school, and her only means to support them is her business.

Ceprodel has given her a hand by supporting the financial growth of her business over the past 3 years with a total of 22 loans, which have had a direct impact on her business. She is now starting to diversify with the sale of slippers and sandals in small quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de la sra. Candelaria es la venta de comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado central preparando variedad de platillos. Tiene 30 años de tener su negocio y se inicio con ahorros personales que almacenaba cuando su madre le regalaba.

Ella inició vendiendo comidas en las afueras del mercado en unas bancas en las cuales ofrecía alimentos al aire libre. Antes de tener este negocio trabajó cortando algodón en las fincas que cultivaban este rubro. Hoy en día la señora M. ha conseguido un lugar bastante cómodo ya que puede extender sus enseres con suficiente espacio para poder vender los alimentos.

Ella es madre soltera que por mucho tiempo atrás ha venido luchando fuertemente para educar a sus dos hijos que están estudiando la primaria y su único medio de sustento es su negocio.

La institución Ceprodel le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio desde hace 3 años con un total de 22 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio ya que está iniciando con ventas de chinelas y sandalias en pocas cantidades por lo que está diversificando su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili is a member of the community bank Nuestro Senor de Martha II, she lives in the Huaraz district in the Ancash department of Peru. Her business varies based on the season of the year.

With this loan of 1300 soles, which will be paid back over the course of the upcoming 6 months, she will purchase various merchandise in order to maximize her sales during the Christmas season: 10 dozen children's gifts, 2 dozen children's pants, 2 dozen game sets for kids, 2 dozen polo shirts for men and women.

Lili is 23 years old, and is the mother of 1 child who is 6 years old. Despite the hardships she has faced at home she continues to push forward with her work. Lili's husband is a taxi driver, and has his own vehicle. Both of them share the responsibility of cover the expenses of their home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestro Señor de Martha II, vive en el distrito de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash. Su negocio es variado de acuerdo a las estaciones del año.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300 soles, el cual será cancelado en cancelado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería variada para aprovechar estas fiestas navideñas: 10 docenas de regalos variados para niños, 2 docenas de pantalones para niños y niñas, 2 docenas de conjuntos para niños y niñas, 2 docenas de polos para damas y caballeros.

La señora Lili tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de 1 niño de 6 años, es conviviente y a pesar de los problemas que tiene en su hogar ha salido adelante, su esposo se dedica a hacer taxi (transportista), cuenta con movilidad propia y ambos comparten los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as decorations, clothes and gifts.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence M. wants to increase the capital in her charcoal business in order to increase inventory. She also wants to buy iron sheets to complete her house in her village. She looks after 5 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for his clients to use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her product diversity and offerings

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a member of the Community Bank Mujeres del Future. She lives in the district of Independencia, in the province of Huaraz in Peru. She sells grain flour (made from wheat, corn, bean, kiwicha and peas) in bulk and in individual packages in the northern cone of Lima.

With this loan of 1500 soles, to be paid back over the course of 6 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of wheat, 2 sacks of peas and 2 sacks of beans to be processed and turned into flour.

Marina is 65 years old, married with 7 children. Her husband worked as a break-maker, and owned his own shop, but now he is too elderly to work. Now her husband helps Marina with her business. Her profits help her to pay for living expenses, and also to help support her single daughter who has 2 children and lives at home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del futuro, vive en el distrito de Independencia, Provincia de Huaraz. Se dedica a la venta de harina de granos (harina de trigo, de maíz, de haba, kiwicha, arvejas), vende por mayor y menor en el cono norte de Lima.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 2 sacos de trigo, 2 sacos de maíz, 2 sacos de arvejas, 2 sacos de haba, para ser transformados en harina.

La señora Marina tiene 65 años, casada y tiene 7 hijos, su esposo antes tenia su panadería, ahora ya no, por la edad ha dejado este negocio. En la actualidad él apoya a su esposa en este negocio. Sus ingresos le permite solventar los gastos del hogar, una de sus hijas es madre soltera con dos hijos, a la que también apoyan económicamente.

loans.use: To purchase grains in bulk

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
Claudia´s business is selling lottery by cash and credit terms. She started this activity 8 years ago with her personal savings.

Initially she sold her product throughout the streets of León, but recently has been working by the corner of the central market, at times placing her life in danger due to the inherent dangerous nature of this business.

Previously Claudia sold newspapers and candy, but she decided to embark on this venture to be able to make more money. She is a tenacious single mother working hard to be able to raise and educate her three small children.

Ceprodel has been providing financial aid to Claudia during the past 18 months through 11 loans. Thanks to these loans she has been able to improve her family´s situation helping her children as well as her poor aging parents.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Lottery purchase

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna is a member of the community bank Nuestro Senor de Martha II. She sells umbrellas and lives int he Huarez district in the Huaraz province of Peru. Her business activities changes based on the time of year it is. She is mobile, and sets up her business in locations that are appropriate for the type of goods being sold. This month she is selling her products in the Christmas Market located in the city of Huarez that is open from the 10th of December until the 2nd of January. This market is located on the pier of the Quillcay River in the Huaraz province, department of Ancash.

With this 2000 soles loan, which will be paid back over the course of 8 months, she will purchase various merchandise to offer her clients for the Christmas festivities: 32 dozen stuffed animals, 8 dozen games, 3 dozen articles of clothing for women and men.

Reyna is a mother of 2 children. She is 32 years old, her husband is a taxi driver and has his own vehicle. Both Reyna and her husband work to contribute to their household expenses, and also to the fees and expenses associated with their children's education.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestro Señor de Martha II, se dedica a la venta de paraguas; vive el el distrito de Huaraz, provincia de Huaraz. Cambia de negocio según las temporadas del año. Ella es ambulante, se ubica en lugares adecuados según la ocasión. En este mes ofrecerá sus productos en la feria navideña en la ciudad de Huaraz que se lleva acabo desde el 10 de diciembre hasta el 2 de enero. Dicha feria está ubicada en el malecón del Río Quillcay, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará mercadería variadas para ofrecer a sus clientas en estas fiesta navideñas: 32 docenas de peluches, 8 docenas de juguetes variados, 3 docenas de ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros.

La señora Reyna es madre de familia de 2 menores hijos y tiene 32 años, su esposo es chofer (transportista) y cuenta con movilidad propia, ambos se apoyan y trabajan para solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus menores hijos.

loans.use: To buy stuffed animals, decorations, buttons and gifts

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth N. wants a loan to purchase crafts from other craft makers. She is going to build a shade in her compound where she will place a market stall. She looks after 5 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase crafts

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia is a member of the communal bank Teresa de Calcuta. She sells vegetables at least 3 days a week- on Monday, Thursday and Saturday. Her business is located in the Huaraz market in the Ancash department of Peru.
