With this loan of 300 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of carrots, 1 sack of betarraga, a Peruvian vegetable, 2 sacks of cabbage, one packet of celery, one packet of pore, and other vegetables.

Teodosia is 36 years old, married, and has 2 young children. Her husband sells meat in the market, and both of them help to support their children and meet the needs of their household.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teodosia pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa de Calcuta, se dedica a la venta de verduras al por menor, los días lunes, jueves y sábado. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de zanahoria, 1 saco de betarraga, 2 sacos de col, un paquete de apio, un paquete de poro y otras verduras.

La señora Teodosia tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo vende carne al por menor, ambos se apoyan para alimentar a sus hijos y satisfacer las necesidades del hogar.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Rodríguez’ business is selling food; she prepares it in her home very early, and then proceeds to sell it in the market. To conduct her business, she buys her ingredients on credit, and pays for them weekly; whenever she has the opportunity, she buys them in cash.

Claudia has 20 years of experience in her business, beginning with a C$1000 loan from a moneylender.

She began her business with her grandmother; they had many difficulties as they sold the food in the doorway of their home on a large wooden table. Later, they decided to sell their food through the streets, carrying all their heavy belongings with them so that they could improve their economic situation.

Ceprodel has brought them financial support for a year and a half with 17 requested credits. These credits have been very useful for the business, and there has been a growth in demand for her food. She is now able to meet her needs by buying ingredients for her food, and she has also been able to attain a sales stand in the dining area of the central market.

It’s important to highlight that Mrs. Claudia Rodríguez is a single mother and has two infant children that she must support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. Rodríguez es la venta de comida la cual la prepara muy temprano en su casa para después proceder a su venta en el mercado. Para poder realizar este negocio, ella compra productos (ingredientes) al crédito pagándolos a la semana y cuando tiene la oportunidad, realiza su compra de contado.

La Sra. Claudia tiene 20 años de tener su e inicio con C$1.000.00 producto del préstamo que realizó a un prestamista.

El negocio inició con su abuela con grandes dificultades ya que ofrecía comida en la puerta de su casa en una mesita de madera y luego decidieron comenzar a vender los alimentos en las calles, cargando con todos los pesados enseres y todo esto para poder salir adelante en su situación económica.

Ceprodel le brindó apoyo por medio de financiamiento por año y medio con 17 créditos otorgados siendo el impacto que han tenido estos créditos de mucha utilidad para su negocio por lo que ha habido un crecimiento en la demanda en su comida ya que ha podido suplir sus necesidades en la compra de los ingredientes de la comida y a la vez ha podido alcanzar un puesto de venta en el sector de las comiderías del mercado central.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que la señora Claudia Rodríguez es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos en la etapa de infancia a los que tiene que mantener.

loans.use: Purchase of goods and materials for a restaurant

loans.name: Dino Salvador

texts.es:
Mr M.'s business is the creation and sale of necklaces, bracelets and hoop earrings which he sells in different places such as markets and in celebrations such as fairs in his town. It has taken him 7 years to build his business with an initial sum of C$3,000.00 (Nicaraguan córdoba), which was an inheritance from his parents and grandparents.

He began his travelling business with the sale of costume jewellery (hoop earrings, bracelets and necklaces) and according to the season he would sell his products. Today he sells his products in the main street where there is a steady flow of customers, making this a fairly dynamic but very tired business given that it is exposed to the sun all day.

In order to support Mr M.’s situation, Ceprodel provided him with financial support a year and a half ago, granting him 8 loans, which have had a direct impact on his business, increasing his sales which in turn allow him to support his family and continue creating and selling his products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva Translator

El negocio al cual se dedica el señor M. es a la elaboración y venta de collares, pulseras y aretes que vende en diferentes lugares como mercados y en actividades de festejos como ferias en su municipio. Tiene 7 años de tener el negocio con un monto inicial de C$ 3.000.00 producto de una herencia obtenida de sus padres y abuelos.

Inició su negocio ambulante con la venta de bisuterías (aretes, pulseras, collares) y según la temporada vendía sus productos. Actualmente vende en la calle principal en donde hay mucha afluencia de clientes siendo este un negocio bastante dinámico pero muy cansado por el hecho de que debe de exponerse al sol todo el día.

Para poder apoyar la situación del señor M. Ceprodel le brindó apoyo financiero desde hace año y medio habiéndosele otorgado 8 créditos, los que han impactado de manera directa incrementando sus ventas para poder así sustentar su hogar y continuar con la elaboración y venta de sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in  new product lines

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline L. currently has 300 birds and collects 4 trays of eggs per day. She wants to buy more chicks and poultry feed. She also wants to cement her house’s floor.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase egg production

loans.name: Dominga Mercedes

texts.es:
Dominga Mercedes M. is a lady of limited resources who began her current economic activity by selling vegetables in the market. To do this she buys vegetables in cash at the market; occasionally she buys on credit, but looks for a way to pay the debt as soon as possible.

Mrs. M. has been in this business for the past 18 years: it is quite an effort because daily she has to carry all of the bags and baskets of vegetables to her stand in the market in Leon. She started her business with money she earned from others she had selling her wares in the area around the market.

Currently her business is located within the central market in Leon, at a stand which has 2 sections, using baskets and buckets loaded with all types of vegetables and fruits.

Before she had this business, she worked in the fields cleaning cotton, but with a lot of effort, together with her husband, they were able to get ahead in order to secure a future for their children.

Ceprodel has been her best ally over the past 3 years with 10 loans granted. She is an excellent client and little by little her business has improved, as has her house, thanks to the credits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dominga Mercedes Martínez es una dama de escasos recursos que inició su actividad económica con la venta de verduras en el mercado. Para ello, compra las verduras de contado en el mercado y en ocasiones compra a crédito pero con mucho esfuerzo, busca la manera de pagar esta deuda lo inmediato posible.

La Señora Martínez tiene este negocio desde hace 18 años atrás costándole muchísimo esfuerzo, por lo que diariamente tiene que cargar con todas las bolsas y canastos de verduras hacia su puesto de venta en el mercado de León. Inicio su negocio con un capital producto de la ganancia de otros negocios que ella tenia vendiendo a los alrededores del mercado con su mercadería al aire libre.

Actualmente su negocio se ubica en el mercado central de León en un puesto de venta que tiene 2 tramos utilizando canastos, panas y baldes, todos cargados de todo tipo de verduras y frutas.

Antes de tener este negocio trabajaba en el campo limpiando algodón pero con mucho esfuerzo y lucha en conjunto con su esposo, lograron salir avantes para garantizar el futuro de sus hijos.

Ceprodel ha sido su mejor aliado en los últimos 3 años con 10 créditos otorgados, excelente cliente y su negocio ha mejorado al igual que su vivienda poquito a poco, gracias a todos los créditos que ella ha recibido.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Mrs. S. buys and sells sweets to college students outside of UNAN-Leon (Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Leon). She has had her own business for 10 years, having started with a sum of C$800.00 from her personal savings.

Her business started as a wooden table on which she sold drinks, bread, and sweets in locations outside of the university, where she was exposed to the sunlight and car traffic because she had to walk across the highway.

Mrs. S. is a great example for women because she is a mother and a widow, and in spite of this, she has been raising her two children through much sacrifice and hard work in her business.

Mrs. S. has received the support from Ceprodel for 2 years now, with a total of 12 loans, which have allowed her to increase her sales volume and thus her income.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. S. se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas a estudiantes universitarios ya que vende a orillas de de la UNAN-León. (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de León). Tiene 10 años de tener su negocio e inicio con un monto de C$ 800.00 producto de ahorros personales.

Su negocio se inició con una mesa de madera vendiendo frescos, pan y golosinas en sectores externos de la universidad donde estaba expuesta al sol y al tráfico vehicular por lo que tenia que cruzar la pista para poder llegar a su punto de venta.

La sra. S. es un gran ejemplo para las mujeres por el hecho de que es madre viuda, y a pesar de esto con dos hijos que los viene formando con mucho sacrificio y lucha diaria por medio de su negocio.

La señora S. ha recibido apoyo de Ceprodel ya que tiene 2 años de estarle financiando su negocio con un total de 12 créditos otorgados que le han beneficiado en el crecimiento de sus productos, aumentando sus ventas y desde luego incrementando sus ganancias.

loans.use: Buying sweets and cereals (Adquisicion de golosinas y cereales)

loans.name: Nanunone's Group

texts.en:
Nanunone N. currently has a profitable canteen and wants to open a second one. She hopes to produce extra profits to help pay school fees for her 5 children and 2 orphans.

The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To open a second canteen

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. M. sells music CDs and materials to make bracelets. She has had her business for 20 years, and has been able to maintain it with lots of effort because she is a very hardworking woman. She started her business with a capital of C$2,000.00, which she received as inheritance from her mother. She started her business as a street vendor, walking through the streets of Leon selling clothes, and then selling regional crafts, trying to diversify her business to see which one yielded better profit, until he started selling CDs and imitation jewelry (bracelets and earrings).

The business of Mrs. Elizabeth is located on the sidewalk of the Bank of Leon, out in the open, but she has faith that she will be able to have her own stand in the market with a better set up to offer her wares and thus being able to support her three children who are in elementary school.

For Mrs. Elizabeth, Ceprodel has been a helping hand for the past 2 years, giving her 11 loans, which have allowed her to increase her quality of life, as well as to expand her business increasing her sales of CDs, bracelets, and earrings.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El trabajo al que se dedica la señora M. es a la venta de discos compactos (CD) musicales y materiales para elaborar pulseras de mano. Hoy en día tiene 20 años de tener su negocio y lo ha mantenido con mucho esfuerzo por ser una mujer muy trabajadora. Inició su negocio con un capital de C$2.000.00 producto de una herencia que le dejo su mamá. Inició su negocio de manera ambulante recorriendo las calles de León vendiendo ropa y luego comenzó a vender artesanías, tratando de diversificar su negocio para ver cual le daba más utilidades hasta que comenzó a vender los discos compactos y artículos de bisutería (pulseras y aretes).

El negocio de la señora Elizabeth está ubicado en la acera del Banco de León al aire libre pero tiene la fe de que tendrá su propio tramo en el mercado y con mayores condiciones para realizar sus ventas y así poder mantener a sus tres hijos que hoy en día cursan sus estudios primarios.

Para la Señora Elizabeth, Ceprodel en los últimos 2 años ha sido su mano amiga, otorgándole 11 créditos que le han mejorado sus condiciones de vida y el impacto que ha tenido es que ha ampliado su negocio con el aumento de las ventas de discos compactos, pulseras y aretes.

loans.use: Buying CDs (Compra de los discos)

loans.name: Rhona's Group

texts.en:
Rhona N. currently rears chickens and pigs as well as makes bricks. She has an investment of 2 million shillings and makes a profit of 50,000 shillings a week (about 35 US Dollars). She raises 5 children and 3 orphans. She will use the loan to buy more chickens, pigs, and material for more bricks.

loans.use: To add animals

loans.name: Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen B. currently rears 500 chickens. Her investment is 2 million shillings and she makes a weekly profit of 4,200 shillings (about $35). She has 4 children and she plans to use the loan to buy more chickens and build another poultry house.

loans.use: To add chickens and add buildings

loans.name: Saida's Group

texts.en:
Saida N. sells Matooke (mashed and cooked bananas) and has a restaurant. She has an investment of 400,000 shillings and makes a profit of about 1,600 shillings ($13) a week. She has 3 children and looks after I orphan. She plans to use the loan to enlarge her fresh food sales.

loans.use: To enlarge her fresh food sales

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth S. wants to own rather than rent her store (as she is doing at the moment). She expects to expand her stock and, for example, have in stock a full lorry of charcoal sacks rather than the 10 sacks she is has in stock now. She is also aiming at building out her own premise for her canteen display.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. loans.use: Own rather than rent her store

loans.name: Jorge Mario

texts.es:
Jorge is a young, single man. He works selling cell phones and accessories, and has been on this business for more than 5 years. He gets his products depending on orders previously made by his customers. He has a small working capital.

Competition in this activity is high, because there are many people offering cell phones. However, the demand for these products is similarly high, so Jorge is not out of work. In addition, he has secured a clientele by offering them good quality products and punctuality in filling out his customer's orders.

The merchandise he buys is all related to cell phones, like cell phone covers, cases, parts, phones, and so on. The prices vary depending on the competition.

This is his fourth loan during his time with this institution, and he has demonstrated to be responsible with his payments. Although he has been late with payments occasionally on his last loan, he quickly regularized his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge es una persona joven y sin compromisos conyugales, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, cuenta con una experiencia en este negocio de más de cinco años. Entrega los productos de acuerdo a pedidos que le hacen anticipadamente los clientes, cuenta con su pequeño capital de trabajo.

La competencia en este rubro es alta, ya que existen bastantes ofertantes de celulares pero paralelamente la demanda también es elevada, por lo que a Jorge no le falta trabajo, además de que él consolido a sus clientes ofreciendoles calidad y puntualidad en la entrega de los productos.

La mercaderia que compra son todas referidas a los celulares; como ser carcasas para celulares, fundas, estuches, repuestos, celulares y otros. Los precios fluctuan de acuerdo a la competencia que exista. Este es el cuarto crédito que ha sacado el cliente, en ese tiempo de relación con la Institución ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus pagos, si bien cuenta con algunos atrasos en su ultimo crédito los mismos fueron regularizados a la brevedad.

loans.use: Buying merchandise, cell phones and accessories (Compra de mercadería accesorios y otros)

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy N. wants to build a house for own clinic rather than renting as she is doing now. With the extra room, she expects to offer her patients bed rest which she cannot do now. She expects to even hire a consultant doctor for her clinic rather than referring patients.

loans.use: Build her own clinic

loans.name: Jane Namugalu's Group

texts.en:
Jane N. wants to be a producer of chicks for rearing rather than producing eggs and chickens.  Specifically, Jane wants to be a wholesaler rather than retailing.  With this loan, Jane plans to increase her stock and sell outside her local area.

loans.use: To sell chicks wholesale

loans.name: Fredy Gustavo

texts.es:
Mr. O. works selling natural drinks (fruit-based and milk-based) prepared by himself in his home. Once he prepares them, he carries them in a cooler with ice and sells them walking through the city of Leon.

It is important to point out that he has had this business for 7 years, starting with a capital of C$200.00, from his own personal savings.

The conditions in which he carries on his business are difficult, because he sells on the sidewalk around the market, and he has the cooler on the floor with an umbrella to block the sunlight. But he has hope that in the future he will be able to have his own stand inside the market.

Ceprodel has offered him unconditional financial support for 12 months now, with a total of 7 loans. The benefits from these loans have been the growth of his business, allowing him to offer a higher quality of drinks, as well as improving his quality of life and home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor O. se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales preparados por el mismo en su casa de habitación siendo estos de diferentes sabores (fruta y leche), una vez preparados los lleva en un termo con hielo y los vende ambulante la ciudad de León.

Es necesario señalar que tiene 7 años de tener el negocio iniciándolo con un capital inicial de C$200.00 producto de ahorros personales que él hacía

Las condiciones de la venta de su negocio son difíciles ya que vende a orillas de la acera en los alrededores del mercado y el termo lo tiene en el suelo con una sombrilla que le cubre del sol, pero tiene la esperanza de futuro de poder tener su propio tramo dentro del mercado.

Ceprodel le ha brindado su apoyo financiero incondicional hace 12 meses llevando actualmente 7 créditos en su record crediticio

El beneficio que ha tenido en estos créditos ha sido el crecimiento en su negocio con refrescos de mejor calidad, como también ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y mejorado su vivienda dignamente.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the preparation of natural drinks (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Juana Jamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. Jamileth T. works selling clothes, sandals, and other wearable things like simple articles and earrings that are not fancy. Mrs. T. has been in this business for 20 years, starting with a sum of C$500.00 from her own savings.

She started her business selling out in the open, carrying her products in a small basket. Then she moved to a cardboard stand, and right now she is located in the eastern side, on the outside of the central market.

Ceprodel has offered her financial support for a period of a year and a half with a total of 10 loans that have allowed her to increase the volume and variety of merchandise she carries, and to support her children whom she has been able to offer a decent life thanks to the income generated by this business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Jamileth T. se refiere a la venta de ropa, sandalias y artículos de vestir como prendas sencillas y aretes que no son lujosos. La señora T. tiene 20 años de estar en el negocio comenzando a trabajar con un monto de C$500.00 producto de fondos propios que tenia ahorrados.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en la orilla Este del mercado central en uno de los tramos externos..

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero por un periodo de año y medio con un total de 10 créditos que le han impactado de manera que ha incrementado su mercadería de todo tipo y logrado la subsistencia para sus hijos que los esta formando gracias al negocio que le genera suficiente utilidad para poder vivir dignamente.

loans.use: Buying clothes (Adquisicion de la ropa)

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucrecia P. is a married woman who lives in a solid home, result of of the hard work of both her and her husband. Mrs. P. has had the fortune that her daughters are studying in college, all thanks to their effort and daily hard work. Her business is buying household items both in cash and on credit, depending on the season.

She has had this business for 20 years, starting with a sum of C$1,000.00 from her own savings.

It all started when Mrs. P., having seen the need for her children to keep going, decided to buy these products and set up herself in a street corner in some cardboard stands. Later she got better established, acquiring a stand in a location with high traffic, attended by a variety of customers, located downtown by the main street. The only inconvenient of this space is that it is very small, so she has to place some of her merchandise on the sidewalk and be careful her products are not lost.

Currently, Mrs. P. has been working with Ceprodel for three years as her best aide in helping her business grow through 26 loans. These loans have had an impact in the expansion of her business, allowing her to acquire more merchandise to support her daughter's studies in college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lucrecia Pérez es una dama casada que vive en un hogar bien solidó producto de la lucha que tienen ambos conyugues para sobrevivir. La señora Pérez ha tenido el privilegio de que una de sus hijas este cursando la universidad y todo gracias a su esfuerzo y lucha en la labor de cada día. El negocio que tiene es la compra a proveedores de contado y al crédito de utensilios del hogar que van dependiendo de la época o temporada.

Tiene 20 años de tener su negocio y lo inició con un monto de C$1.000.00 producto del ahorro personal.

Todo comenzó cuando la señora Pérez al ver la necesidad de que sus hijos debían de salir adelante, decidió adquirir estos productos y colocarse en la esquina de una calle en casetas de cartón, posteriormente se fue ubicando mejor teniendo un puesto donde fluyen variedad de clientes ubicada en el centro Metropolitano a orilla de la calle principal en uno de sus módulos. El único inconveniente que tiene es el espacio del modulo que es bastante pequeño por lo que tiene que sacar mercadería a la acera teniendo el cuidado que no se le extravíen sus productos.

La señora Pérez hoy en día con Ceprodel tiene tres años de estar trabajando siendo su mejor aliado en el crecimiento de su negocio con 26 créditos otorgados que han tenido impacto en la ampliación de su negocio obteniendo mayor mercadería para así avanzar con los estudios de su hija que cursa la universidad.

loans.use: Buying utensils, household items (Compra de utensilios)

loans.name: Herman

texts.es:
Herman is a 37-year-old man; his wife is a homemaker and takes care of their children. Herman works as an electrician and currently works for a business called ALBAPOR. He receives a monthly salary from this job, and on weekends and holidays, he offers his services as an electrician.

Herman has worked for ALBAPOR for many years, since the opening of the business, and in parallel, he works as an electrician for businesses or private homes.

Because of the time he has worked for ALBAPOR, he is part of the personnel and does not compete with the business, in addition, the competition for electrician jobs is low because there is a high demand but not a lot of people offering this sort of service in the city of Portachuelo.

The fees Herman charges are accessible to everyone, which is an advantage for Herman because so many people seek his services.

RIght now, Herman has another loan from Agrocapital, and he has been showing good behavior with his existing loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Herman es una señor de 37 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa y también cuida a sus hijos. Herman se dedica prestar servicios de electricista y actualmente trabaja como dependiente de una empresa que se llama ALBAPOR, en esta empresa el percibe un sueldo mensual y los fines de semana y días feriados se dedica a prestar sus servicios como electricista.

Trabaja hace bastantes años en ALBAPOR desde su la inauguración de la empresa hasta la fecha y paralelamente el mismo tiempo trabaja como electricista en empresas o casas particulares. Debido al tiempo de trabajo en la empresa ALBAPOR el es parte del personal fijo por lo que no representa una amenaza, por otra parte en el rubro de servicios de electricidad la competencia es baja ya que no hay mucha oferta de este servicio en la ciudad de Portachuelo. Los precios que cobra por otorgar sus servicios son bastante accesibles a todo bolsillo, por lo que esto se constituye en una ventaja más para Herman ya que muchos clientes lo buscan. Actualmente tiene una deuda más aparte de la presente en Agrocapital, pero en ambas tiene un comportamiento bueno.

loans.use: Working capital  (Capital operativo para comercio de apicultura)

loans.name: Marcia Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Marcia's activity is to buy apples and grapes during the Christmas season to then sell them. She has been in this business for 4 years, starting with a sum of C$1,000.00 from her personal savings.

She started in the market at Leon's terminal, on a wooden table, and later moved to a place outside the Cathedral, which is a good spot with much traffic of cars and people.

As you can see, these are not the best conditions for selling fruits, so she doesn't have an established place to sell.

Aside from that, Mrs. Marcia is a single mom who is working hard to keep going and support her two daughters who are currently in junior high school.

Mrs. Marcia has established a solid financial bond with Ceprodel, to help her grow her business. In the past 5 months she has been given 2 loans, which increased her working capital and the financial wellbeing of her two daughters, who now receive better nutrition and care.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Marcia es la compra de contado de manzanas y uvas por temporada navideña para luego comercializarlas. Tiene 4 años de estar en el negocio y se inicio con un monto de C$1.000.00 obtenidos por sus ahorros personales.

Inicia en el mercado la Terminal de León en una mesa de madera y posteriormente se traslada al atrio de la iglesia de la Catedral, punto llamativo por el tráfico vehicular y de gente que se moviliza en el sector.

Como se puede notar no son las mejores condiciones para vender sus frutas por lo que aun no tiene un lugar estable para vender.

Además de lo anterior, la señora Marcia es madre soltera que ha luchando para salir adelante con sus dos hijas que actualmente cursan la secundaria.

La señora Marcia ha establecido con Ceprodel una alianza de financiamiento solidó que le ayuda al crecimiento de su negocio con 5 meses de estar trabajando y lleva dos créditos otorgados teniendo un impacto del crédito en un crecimiento de su capital de trabajo, mejor bienestar económico para su dos hijas que están estudiando ya que les da mejor alimentación, salud y cuidados por ser sus únicas hijas que le ha costado mucho formar.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables (Compra de frutas y vegetales)

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Marcos started his business 9 years ago, as a street vendor, traveling to Honduras to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes, and household items. His business is set up on a table where he places his products for their sale outside of the Cathedral of Leon.

His initial capital was C$2,000.00, a product of his termination from his previous job. His business is now established in a corner of the Cathedral of Leon.

With Ceprodel's support, he managed to increase his working capital, because he is a person invested in his family, which is currently going through the process of educating and raising two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Don Marcos inició su negocio hace 9 años de manera ambulante, viajando a Honduras para comprar mercadería tales como ropa, calzados y algunos enseres para el hogar. Su negocio lo tiene establecido en una mesa donde coloca sus productos para su respectiva venta a orillas de la Iglesia Catedral de León.

Su capital inicial fue de C$2.000.00 producto de una liquidación de su trabajo anterior, teniendo establecido actualmente su negocio en la esquina de la iglesia de la Catedral de León.

Con el apoyo de Ceprodel logró incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que es una persona comprometida con su familia que está en el proceso de educación y desarrollo por tener 2 niños menores de edad.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercaderia)

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. G. is a single mom (widowed), working hard to support and raise her 3 children who are in elementary school. She works preparing meat in her home to then send it in the central market to her customers.

Her business started outside of the market, selling with a table and some benches. Right now she is inside the market, in the prepared food section, with a better set-up. She started this business 25 years ago, starting with a sum of C$1,000.00 from a loan given from a central market lender.

With Ceprodel's support she has continued to grow with a total of 19 loans in the past 3 years. These loans have allowed her to improve her family's quality of life by increasing the quantity and quality of the meals she can offer, which is a dish called Carne Baho (meat, yuca, plantain, banana, cabbage salad).

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gutiérrez es una madre soltera (viuda) luchando para mantener y desarrollar a sus 3 hijos que estudian en la primaria. Se dedica a preparar carne en su hogar para luego vender este alimento en el mercado central y allí poder venderlo a sus clientes.

Su negocio se inicio por fuera del mercado vendiendo en una mesa y sus bancos. Actualmente esta dentro del mercado en el sector de las comidas con mejores condiciones. Inició este negocio hace 25 años comenzando con un monto de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo que le otorgó a un prestamista del mercado.

Con Ceprodel de la mano siguió adelante desde hace 3 años con un total de 19 créditos otorgados que le han impactado en mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia aumentando la cantidad y calidad de su comida que ofrece que es la llamada Carne Baho. (Carne, yuca, plátano verde, plátano maduro, ensalada de repollo).

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare meals (Compra de los ingredientes para  alimento)

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. R.' business consists of preparing food of all sorts, including breakfasts and lunches which are popular among her customers. She started selling in a corner of the central market, on a bench with some pots where she carried her food. Now she sells in the southwestern corner of the market in a location that gets her a lot of attention from customers.

Maria R. has had this business for 34 years, and she started with an initial capital investment of C$ 1.500.00 thanks to a loan she got.

Ceprodel has been supporting her for 3 years now, giving her 25 loans which have increased her business, improved her locale with tables and chairs for her customers as well as more space for them.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la señora Rodríguez es elaborar comida de todo tipo todos los días desde desayunos y almuerzos, en donde logra acaparar la atención de los clientes. Comenzó vendiendo en la esquina del mercado central en una banca y unas panas en las que traía su comida, ahora vende en la esquina sur-oeste del mercado central en lugar vistoso y llamativo para su clientela.

Maria Rodríguez tiene 34 años de tener este negocio y dio inicio con un capital inicial de C$ 1.500.00 gracias a un préstamo que realizo.

Ceprodel apoyándola desde hace 3 años le ha concedido 25 créditos que han incrementado su negocio, ha mejorado su lugar de trabajo con mesas y sillas para los clientes y a la vez tiene mayor espacioso físico para los clientes.

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare food (Compra de ingredientes para la comida)

loans.name: Natividad De

texts.es:
Natividad is a 32-year-old woman. She has a family of eight, the two parents and 6 children who are 17, 15, 13, 11, 9, and 7 years old. Natividad has a business in her home, which is located in the community of Los Ciervos, more than 30 Km. away from Warnes. In this business, she sells general store products, cosmetics, and she also uses the space as a beer distributor. She tends to this business Monday to Sunday.

Natividad has over 10 years of experience in this activity so she is very well known in her area and can count on regular customers, which decreases her risk from competing businesses. Her business is one of the largest in the area.

The purpose of this loan is to buy merchandise to stock her business. The prices of these products vary depending on the season and price variation from the different merchants. She has a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Natividad es una señora de 32 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por ocho personas, los dos padres y sus seis hijos que tienen 17, 15, 13, 11, 9 y 7 años respectivamente. Natividad tiene su negocio que se encuentra en su domicilio y se ubica en la Comunidad de los Ciervos, misma que se encuentra distante a más de 30 Km. de Warnes, en el negocio ella vende abarrotes, cosméticos, también aprovecha el espacio como distribuidora de cerveza, este negocio lo atiende de lunes a domingo.

Natividad cuenta ya con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 10 años por lo que es bastante conocida en la zona y por lo tanto cuenta con clientela fija, disminuyendo de esta forma el riesgo de la competencia que es relativamente media. Su negocio es uno de los comercios más grandes de la zona. La presente solicitud es para adquirir mercadería, para surtir su negocio. Los precios de estos producto varian de acuerdo a la época y a las variaciones de precios de los proveedores. Sus antecedentes crediticios en el sistema financiero son muy buenos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell (Capital de trabajo)

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida N. wants to expand her stock by adding more chickens and goats to her business (she only has a few she is rearing at the moment). She expects to build a Kraal for her goats and a poultry house for her chicks. She currently raises her animals in a small room in her house. This will expand her business and her income as well.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her goat herd

loans.name: Maura Eliette

texts.es:
Maura buys her products in Managua from suppliers who offer products made from fabric (plush toys). She sells to some clients on credit and to the rest for cash. Ms. Chávez has been working in this business for 15 years and started it with C$5,000 which she received as a loan from a microfinancier.

She started her business selling from a small zinc stall and then opened in another space that her father left her. The stalls only had a zinc roof and the sides were open but she has a good location in a section of the central market in the city of León in Nicaragua.

Before starting her business, she was a student but stopped her studies because her parents were living in poverty. For this reason she started working in the market when she was very young.

Ceprodol has given her financial support for the expansion of her business over the past two years with 7 loans granted. With these loans, she has been able to expand her business by offering a greater quantity and variety of products and she and her family have been able to lead a better life.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maura compra sus productos en Managua a proveedores que ofrecen productos elaborados a base de tela (peluches). Vende en parte por encargo algunos clientes y el resto al público en general todo de contado. La señora Chávez tiene 15 años de estar en el negocio que se inició con C$5.000.00 producto de un préstamo que le hizo una micro financiera.

La historia del negocio se inicia vendiendo en una caseta de zinc, luego paso a otro lado que fué un lugar que le heredo su padre. Las casetas solo tenían techo de zinc con los lados descubiertos estando pero hoy en día se encuentra bien ubicada en un tramo en el mercado central de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Antes de tener su negocio estudiaba pero dejo de estudiar por las condiciones de pobreza que tenían sus padres que la hizo encaminarse al mercado desde muy joven.

Ceprodel le brindo apoyo financiero en el crecimiento de su negocio con 2 años y habiéndole otorgado 7 créditos. A raíz de este préstamo que ha tenido se ha podido notar el crecimiento de su negocio con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos en venta y en mejor nivel de vida para ella y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Rafael L. has sold hardware products for the past 20 years. He started out with products he purchased when the company he worked for was liquidated, and he invested those in his own business.

Mr. L. is a great example of someone who started out with a workbench and a few products that hardly anyone would buy, then with a total of 12 loans from Ceprodel has been able to develop and grow over the past year and a half, diversifying his market and gaining an advantage over his competition.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rafael López tiene 20 años de tener el negocio de venta de productos ferreteros que se inició con producto de una liquidación de su trabajo y los invirtió en su propio negocio.

El señor López es un gran ejemplo para muchas personas ya que inició con una mesa de madera con pocos productos los cuales casi nadie le compraba sin embargo, con Ceprodel se ha desarrollado y crecido desde hace año y medio con un total de 12 créditos otorgados produciendo un crecimiento de su ferretería diversificando su mercado y ocupando una posición ventajosa con relación a su competencia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Regina Ramona

texts.es:
Regina works selling tortillas and cheese, every 3 days. She has had the business for 21 years; she started it with $1000 in capital, the product of an inheritance left to her by her mother.

At the age of 12, Regina started selling outside the supermarket since her mother was very poor. It took a lot of effort to get ahead, but she has succeeded in doing so. Currently her business is located outside the supermarket in the open air and in difficult conditions.

Regina's efforts are focused on the education of her children. Thanks to the unconditional support of Ceprodel, the strong pillar of her development during the 2 years that she has been working with the organization, she has succeeded in obtaining 11 loans. The loans have helped her substantially increase her sales and have allowed her to keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Su actividad económica es la compra de tortillas y quesillos, actividad que la hace cada 3 días, teniendo 21 años de poseer este negocio con un capital de C$1.000.00 producto de herencia que le dejo su mamá.

La señora Regina inició a los 12 años de edad vendiendo a orillas del supermercado ya que su mamá era muy pobre y tenia que salir adelante y hoy en día a raíz de mucho esfuerzo lo ha podido lograr.

Actualmente el negocio lo tiene ubicado a orillas del supermercado al aire libre teniendo condiciones difíciles. Sus esfuerzos los concentra en sus hijos para su preparación.

Gracias a la ayuda incondicional de Ceprodel, quien ha sido el pilar fuerte para su desarrollo en los 2 años que tiene de estar trabajando, ha logrado obtener 11 créditos los que le han ayudado a incrementar sustancialmente las ventas y poder mantener su negocio activo.

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Rita Lucrecia

texts.es:
Rita Lucrecia is a woman who started her own business 9 years ago with a small capital investment of $1000, the product of a loan made at a high interest rate by a money lender. With that first loan she established her business selling products such as preserves, vinegars, condiments and on occasion, meals she prepares herself.

She started out selling her products from her house and later succeeded in locating her business inside the central market, in one of the principal entrances. The quality of her products has continually improved thanks to the support she has received from Ceprodel. She has now received 22 loans, which have played a big part in her growth. She has improved her sales stall and now it is quite advantageous, large and attractive. Rita has been receiving loans from Ceprodel for 3 years and has had excellent results to date.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rita Lucrecia es una dama que inicia su negocio hace 9 años con un pequeño capital de trabajo de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo que le hizo un prestamista a tasas bastante altas, estableciendo su negocio de venta de productos como enlatados, vinagres, condimentos y en ocasiones comidas preparadas por ella misma.

Inicia vendiendo en su casa y luego logra ubicar su negocio en el interior del mercado central en una de las entradas principales. La calidad del producto ha venido mejorando satisfactoriamente gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel ya que ha tenido 22 créditos que le han servido mucho para su crecimiento por lo que el puesto de venta lo ha mejorado y esta bastante favorable, amplio y vistoso. Ella tiene 3 años de tener crédito con Ceprodel y hasta hoy ha tenido excelentes resultados.

loans.use: Investment in the sales of spices and pickled foods

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia is a woman of 53 years and she and her four children, who are 29, 20, 18 and 15 years old, support her family.

Basilia has two businesses that are located in the new market in the city of Warnes. In one of the stalls she sells chickens and in the other she sells salteñas (a type of empanada), empanadas, refreshments and other products.

She has over 12 years of business experience, specifically in the sale of chickens and other food products.

She has some competition in both businesses because in the market there are people that also offer the same or similar products, but Basilia has the advantage that with her 12 years of experience she has a fixed clientele.

The prices of her products vary in both of her businesses and she is requesting this loan to repay a debt.

Her loan history is good.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Basilia es una señora de 53 años de edad, su familia se encuentra compuesta por ella y sus cuatro hijos que tienen 29, 20, 18 y 15 años respectivamente.

Basilia tiene dos negocios que se encuentran ubicados en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad de Warnes, en uno de los puestos vende pollos y en el otro puesto vende salteñas, empanadas, refrescos y otros.

Tiene una experiencia de más de 12 años en el rubro del comercio, especificamente en la venta de pollos y otros productos alimenticios.

Su competencia es media en ambas actividades debido a que en el mercado hay personas que también ofrecen productos iguales o similares, pero la ventaja de Basilia es que al tener 12 años de experiencia cuenta con clientela fija.

Los precios de sus productos son variables en ambos comercios, la solicitud del crédito es para la devolución de un anticrético.

Sus antecedentes crediticios son muy buenos.

loans.use: Debt repayal

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosita C. makes atole, a delicious hot drink very popular in Nicaragua, in her home. Later she sells it all around the marketplace. When she runs out of atole she starts with her sales of bread, again throughout the whole market and until she has sold it all.

Rosita has had this business for 18 years; she started it with $100 of her personal savings. She started the business selling in the streets with her mother, who helped her to carry the atole. Later Rosita's mother left the business in her daughter's hands, trusting her to carry on in the business without losing the clients they had worked hard to win.

Rosita is a woman worth emulating. She is a single mother who is willing to fight to get ahead. She has 5 children: 2 in the university, 1 in secondary school and 2 in primary school. Rosita has raised her children through a lot of personal sacrifice.

Ceprodel has been giving Rosita support in her business for 3 years, through a total of 21 loans. The loans have impacted the growth of her business of atole sales; she has been able to buy more ingredients with which to prepare the delicious atoles enjoyed by her community.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica de la señora Rosita C. se inicia preparando atole en su casa y vendiéndolos por todos los alrededores del mercado. Una vez terminado el atole inicia con la venta de pan por todo el mercado hasta terminarlo.

Rosita tiene 18 años de tener el negocio el cual inició con C$100.00 producto de ahorro personal. Su historia es que inicia el negocio vendiendo de ambulante junto con su mamá, que le ayudaba a cargar las panas de atole, luego su mama le dejo en sus manos el negocio para que siguiera la tradición y no perder los clientes que hasta ese momento habían obtenido.

Rosita es una mujer digna de imitar por el hecho de que es madre soltera, muy luchadora ya que con 5 hijos ya tiene 2 universitarios, 1 en la secundaria y 2 en la primaria, que los ha preparado a base de mucho sacrificio.

Ceprodel le ha brindado un apoyo en su negocio desde hace 3 años con un total de 21 créditos otorgados que le han impactado en el crecimiento del negocio de la venta de atoles ya que ha podido comprar mas insumos para preparar los deliciosos atoles en su comunidad.

loans.use: Buy raw materials with which to make bread and atole, a delicious, hot drink made of corn

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret B. wants a loan to buy more tables, chairs, and umbrellas for her bar. More than that, she wants to buy more equipment and more crates of beer for her bar. Margaret believe that her bar needs more glasses and more brands of beer.

With the loan, Margaret also wants to add lodging to her bar and expects to open up a depot of beer for supplying others.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. loans.use: Expand her bar

loans.name: Ester's Group

texts.en:
Ester N. wants to expand her business to wholesale sales rather than being a retail trader. She wants to use the loan to expand her premises. She wants to open a supermarket and import products at cheaper prices to generate higher profits. She wants to become a wholesaler to various retail shops in the area.

loans.use: To expand to wholesale sales

loans.name: Rosa De La Cruz

texts.es:
Rosa's daily work starts at her home, when she leaves each morning to transport the 2 carts containing hot dogs to her sales location. She has 9 years of experience in this business; she started with $700 in capital loaned to her by a microfinance organization.

With that first loan, she began selling hot dogs, sweets and soft drinks on the corner close to the Cathedral of León. Daily she fought the fatigue caused by the sun, hoping in the future to have her own sales stall in the market.

Later Mrs. Díaz S. was visited by Ceprodel's loan staff and received the financial help she needed to develop her business. That was 2 years ago; she has received 35 loans since then. The loan has had a positive impact on her business, including its expansion and growth.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Su actividad económica da inicio desde su casa en donde acarrea dos carretones conteniendo hot dogs hasta su puesto de venta. Teniendo 9 años de experiencia en este negocio, la señora Rosa inició con un capital de C$700.00 producto de un préstamo que hizo en una micro financiera.

Comenzó a vender los hot dog, golosinas y refrescos ubicado el negocio en la esquina cerca de la iglesia de la Catedral de León, teniendo que luchar a diario contra la fatiga del sol, esperando en el futuro llegar a tener un local propio en el mercado.

Posteriormente la señora Díaz S. fue visitada por personal de crédito de Ceprodel y recibió la ayuda financiera necesaria para desarrollarse hace 2 años, habiendo recibido 35 créditos que han tenido impacto positivo en su negocio como lo es la ampliación de este mismo.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 29 years old, married and has two children who are 8 and 5 years old.

She is a teacher on the Warnes faculty, and she also sells clothing on the side. He husband is a driver for the KASKOTE company.

Cecilia has enough experience in both businesses and has some competition because there are other people who offer the same services and products in the same area.

This petition for a loan is so that she can purchase clothing and stock her business because the demand for these articles grows at this time of year, and also because the prices depend on the quality of the fabric and the finishing. The origin of the clothing also affects the price.

Cecilia’s loan history is financially sound.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una señora de 29 años de edad esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad.

Cecilia es maestra en el magisterio de Warnes, adicionalmente y de forma paralela se dedica al comercio de ropa. Su esposo es chofer de la empresa KASKOTE.

Cecilia tiene experiencia bastante experiencia en las dos actividades que realiza, su competencia es de nivel medio ya que también hay otras personas que ofrecen los mismos servicios y productos en la misma zona inclusive.

La presente solicitud es para que pueda adquirir y surtir su negocio de ropa ya que la demanda de estos artículos incrementa en esta época del año, por otra parte los precios de los mismos dependen de la calidad de la tela y acabado, tambien prepondera en el precio la procedencia de la prenda.

Los antecedentes de Cecilia son buenos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maureen's Group

texts.en:
Maureen N. wants a loan to open up a shop for second hand clothes. She even wants to start importing second hand cargoes from abroad. This will help her in her shops’ availability of clothes. In the future, Maureen expects to move away from second hand clothes to already made clothes (new clothes) which are selling better than second hand clothes. This will increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Rosalio Palermo

texts.es:
Mr. O.'s business is the purchase and sale and new watches, and used watches that he repairs and sells in good condition. He has been in this business for 10 years. He started the business with an initial investment of $500, the product of savings and earnings from other sales.

Mr. O. started his business in the market at the transport station, vending while walking through the station. Later he moved to the central market, where he still doesn't have a fixed stall. One of his objectives is to be able to acquire his own sales stall.

Ceprodel has been his best ally. During the 2 years Ceprodel has been financing his working capital, he has received 9 loans. Through those loans his business has improved through the purchase of better merchandise: new and attractive watches for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio del Sr. O. es la compra venta de relojes nuevos y usados los que los repara para venderlos en buen estado. Tiene 10 años de tener el negocio e inició con un monto inicial de C$500.00 producto de ahorros y ganancias de otras ventas.

El Sr. O. inicia el negocio en el mercado de la Estación, de forma ambulante y luego se traslada al mercado central, del cual no tiene tramo (espacio físico) y este es uno de sus objetivos de futuro en poder adquirir su propio local.

Ceprodel ha sido su mejor aliado y en los dos años de estarle financiando su capital de trabajo le han otorgado 9 créditos totales que han hecho que su negocio presente mejoras por la compra de mejores mercancías en relojes nuevos y atractivos para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of tools for the repair of electronics (watches)

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara works buying and selling lottery tickets. She has her regular clients but does most of her sales selling from her sales post. She has worked in her lottery business for 21 years. She started out with $1000 borrowed from a local money lender at a monthly interest rate of 20%, which was a very expensive way to start her business.

She started her business on the corner of Banco in León with a basket of sweets. At the same time she sold lottery tickets out of doors throughout the city. Currently her sales post is located on the principal street of León in a visible location.

Xiomara is an enterprising single mother who fights to get ahead. She has 3 children, all of whom are currently in school, 2 in secondary school, thanks to Xiomara's daily sacrifice to support the family on her own.

Ceprodel has given Xiomara wonderful support with financial help for 3 years with 16 loans. The loans have given Xiomara the opportunity to buy a larger quantity of lottery tickets to sell and as a result, to provide the necessities to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Xiomara es a la actividad económica de la compra y venta de lotería teniendo sus clientes fijos pero siendo su mejor anhelo vender en su puesto de venta.

La señora Xiomara Tiene 21 años de tener el negocio iniciando con un capital de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo a un prestamista al 20% mensual, que por cierto fue muy costoso.

Comenzó su negocio en la esquina del Banco en León con una canasta de caramelos y a la vez vendía lotería a la intemperie por todos los sectores del mercado. Actualmente está ubicada en la calle principal en un punto de venta visible.

Es madre soltera, luchadora, emprendedora con 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando teniendo 2 en la secundaria, producto del sacrificio que ella hace a diario.

Ceprodel le ha brindado un gran apoyo con ayuda financiera desde hace 3 años y con 16 créditos las que le han beneficiado en la compra de mayor cantidad de lotería y sustento para su hogar.

loans.use: Buy lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. wants to increase the production of her bakery. She wants to start producing products for various areas like schools, shops, and supermarkets. This loan will help her to increase the raw materials necessary for her bakery like cartons of wheat flour and Jeri cans of oil. Elizabeth wants to enlarge her business and expects that, at one point in the future, she will be able to produce bread and cakes for parties, weddings, and many more occasions. This will allow her to enlarge and promote her business.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of her bakery

loans.name: Deicy

texts.es:
Deicy is a mother, separated and 30 years old. Her husband went to Argentina but sends her money for their three school-age children who live with Deicy in a home in the Alto Pagador sector of the city of Cochabamba.

Deicy sells accessories and utensils for the home in bulk or retail, such as: blankets, comforters, kitchen utensils and other home products. She has more than 10 years experience in this type of business, she sells on different market days in various provinces, she also sells in the Cancha sector during the Wednesday and Saturday markets. The competition is high, especially in Cancha, as many people are selling the same products, but Deicy faces this competition by working harder and moving from place to place, she never stays in just one spot.

Deicy buys comforters and blankets from wholesalers in La Paz and sells them for a higher price, either per unit or by quarter- or half-dozen. She also sells pots, pans, spoons, forks and other kitchen utensils, the prices vary and she resells at a higher price since the service she offers is to bring the merchandise practically to someone's door or to where there are no markets.

This request is her seventh with our institution; at the same time she has a loan with another organization but her track record in both financial institutions is good.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Deicy es una madre separada de 30 años de edad, su esposo se fue a la Argentina pero le manda dinero para sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar y viven con Deicy en una casa familiar en el sector de Alto Pagador de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Deicy se dedica al comercio al por menor y mayor de accesorios y utencilios para el hogar como son; frazadas, edredones, utencilios de cocina y otros del hogar. En este tipo de rubro tiene una experiencia de más de 10 años, vende en diferentes ferias en las distintas provincias, como también ambula en el sector de la CANCHA los días de feria miércoles y sábado. La competencia en este tipo de negocio es elevada y sobre todo en la CANCHA, existe mucha gente que se dedica al comercio de estos productos, pero Deicy hace frente a la misma esforzandose y recorriendo varios lugares, no se queda en un solo lugar.

Deicy compra a los mayoristas paceños los edredones y frazadas y ella vende ya sea por unidades, cuartas o medias docenas a un precio más elevado. También vende ollas, sartenes, cucharas, tenedores y otros artículos de cocina, los precios de los mismos varian de acuerdo al artículo y aumentan ya que ella el servicio que ella ofrece es prácticamente de llevar a domicilio o donde no hay mercados. Esta solicitud es la séptima con nuestra Institución, paralelamente tiene un crédito con otra entidad financiera pero su comportamiento en ambas financieras es bueno.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy K. wants to increase her stock of general merchandise so that she can be able to meet her needs. She also wants to buy a landline telephone so she can use it as a pay phone for customers.

loans.use: To increase stock and purchase phone

loans.name: Racheal's Group

texts.en:
Rachel N. wants to take a loan in order to build a chicken house and increase her flock so that she may be able to better care for her children.

loans.use: To construct a chicken house

loans.name: Gueider

texts.es:
Gueider is a 38 years old married man. His wife is a domestic employee in the house of a group of Japanese expatriates. Gueider is dedicated to public transport, he is a "motorcycle-taxi driver", he owns two bikes, the one he drives and the other one he rents out.

His experience as a driver in that zone is pretty vast, due to the high demand on that specific zone he only works there. There are a lot of competitors but there are plenty of clients for all of them. The average price per trip is about Bs.2.00, which is an accessible price to everyone’s budget. Gueider has no negative records at his headquarters and in any other centers of information.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Gueider es un señor casado de 38 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica en la casade un grupo de japoneses. Gueider se dedica al transporte público, trabaja como mototaxista y paralelamente recibe la el ingreso que le genera la renta de su otra moto.

Su experiencia como chofer de motos en la zona es bastante amplia ya que la misma demanda permite trabajar continuamente en este rubro. Si bien existe gran competencia en el rubro de transporte en taximotos así también es de elevada la demanda por este medio de transporte. El precio que se cobra por carrera promedio asciende a Bs. 2.-, que es un precio accesible a todo tipo de bolsillo. Gueider no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni en otros burós de información.

loans.use: Repair two motorcycles

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose N. wants to increase her stock of second hand clothes and build a temporary market for her goods.

loans.use: To build a store and increase stock

loans.name: Mutebi's Group

texts.en:
Mutebi N. wants to expand her business and construct a permanent stall. Mutebi has a general merchandise retail business and wants to have a permanent stall so that she will be free from the rain.

loans.use: To construct a permanent stall

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet currently has a shop. She wants to take a loan to begin a poultry business alongside the existing shop to increase her sales and profits.

Sophie S. has 5 dependents. With a loan, she wishes to start a mini—grocery store to sell fresh food such as sweet potatoes, vegetables, Irish potatoes (russets), cassava, etc.

loans.use: To start a mini-grocery store

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. sells retail clothing out of her home. She looks after one orphan, one widow, and one disabled person. She needs a new house because her current one floods when it rains.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a better house/store

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista N. looks after 6 orphans and one old woman with goiter disease. She wants a loan to increase her capital so that she can increase her stock of charcoal and increase her sales and profits. She needs extra profits to pay school fees for the orphans.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nakyeyune's Group

texts.en:
Nakyeyune O. wants to build a house and store. She currently sells her clothing outdoors. When it rains her merchandise is damaged. She is looking after 2 orphans.

loans.use: To build a house/store

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose N. currently sells charcoal and needs a new building to keep her stock dry when it rains. She looks after 4 orphans and would like to buy land for them.

loans.use: To build a new store

loans.name: Laura's Group

texts.es:
This group is an extension of an older group. The contact for this group is one of the women who used to work for the Municipality of Asunción. She held an informational meeting about Fundación Paraguaya, which various women attended.

They then decided to form the group, and today they all work and they pay their loans jointly. They all do different types of business such as the sale of wallets, shoes, fast food and jewelry and others have general stores and kiosks.

Today they hope to receive a loan to buy different types of merchandise depending on each of their businesses, among other products they would like to purchase sugar, flour, meat, vegetables, fruits, wallets, jewelry, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Este Comité es un desprendimiento de un grupo antiguo. El contacto con este grupo una de las señoras que en ese entonces trabajaba en la Municipalidad de Asunción. Ella invito a la reunión informativa acerca de la Fundación Paraguaya, donde asistieron varias señoras.

Decidieron entonces conformar su grupo, y hoy día todas trabajan y pagan de forma solidaria sus créditos. Ellas se dedican a distintos tipos de actividades como ventas de carteras, zapatos, comidas rápidas, joyas, otras poseen despensa y, kioscos.

Hoy día desean adquirir un préstamo para comprar diferentes tipos de mercaderías dependiendo de la actividad de cada una, entre otros podemos citar: azúcar, harina, carne, vegetales, frutas, carteras, joyas, zapatos, cosméticos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, meat, vegetables, fruits, wallets, jewelry, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth L. operates a hotel (note: "hotel" often means "restaurant" in Uganda). She wants the loan to purchase a fridge, chairs, and tables so that she can accommodate more customers and get more profits. She looks after 5 children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
The committee “Fighting for Progress” was born when a member of another committee decided to form her own group.

The participants work in different activities, like selling fruits, clothes, jewelry, fast food, ice cream; others have stores where they sell groceries like sugar, rice, flour, soft drinks, juices, bread, etc.

They are asking for a loan so the can purchase clothes, jewelry, sugar, rice, soft drinks, etc., and others need to get material to create their products like fabric, blenders, etc.

Each participant receives approximately G 900,000 ($190 USD) each.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité “Luchando por el Progreso” nació con el contacto de unas de las integrantes de otro comité de la misma zona que decidió formar su grupo.

Las clientas trabajan en distintos tipos de actividades, como venta de frutas, ropas, lencerías, comidas rápidas, helados, otras tienen despensas donde venden productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, arroz, harina, gaseosas, jugos, panificados, etc.

Solicitan el crédito para poder adquirir mercaderías como , ropas, lencerías, azúcar, arroz, bebidas, etc., otras necesitan materiales para realizar sus actividades como telas , licuadoras, etc. Cada integrante lleva aproximadamente G. 900.000 ($ 190) cada una.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, jewelery, sugar, rice, juices, fabric, blender, etc.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy N. is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a photocopying machine for her shop. In addition, she intends to use the loan to increase the stationery in her shop.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to construct a permanent charcoal shop

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
The committee LA AMISTAD (Friendship) was formed more than a year ago and belongs to the Marketalia neighborhood, an area occupied by low-income people. Eight years ago, this area was granted by the government as a result of the pressure exerted by the homeless, who are now in the process of obtaining property titles.

The women who belong to the committee carry out different activities: some of them run a grocery shop at home, while others sell clothes, medicines and food, either at home or door-to-door.

As a group, they are stable and pay their installments timely. At the Foundation and also within the group, they have accumulated savings for GS 3.250.000, deposited at a savings cooperative institution from the area. They also organize group activities, such as raffles and fund-raisers, in order to establish a help fund, to be used in the case of sickness of a member, or to make early payments as a group.

They will allocate the money to the purchase of merchandise, according to the different activities of the members: in the case of the grocery stores, to buy meat, cheese, milk , as well as wine and cider, taking into account the coming holidays. In the case of the clothes sellers, they will buy holiday and kids clothes. Those who sell food intend to invest in other businesses, like toys and fireworks sales. Finally, those who sell beverages or groceries wish to incorporate ice creams and cool drinks for the coming hot season.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité LA AMISTAD se formó hace ya más de un año y pertenece a la zona de Marketalia, donde conviven personas de escasos recursos. Ya hace ocho años, esta zona fue cedida por el gobierno como resultado de la presión de los sin techo, que ahora están en trámites para obtener su título de propiedad.

Las señoras desarrollan diferentes actividades: algunas tienen su negocio de despensa en su casa, mientras que las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren de puerta en puerta.

Como grupo, es un comité estable y pagan con puntualidad sus cuotas. En la Fundación y dentro del grupo también, poseen un ahorro de GS 3.250.000, que lo depositan en una Cooperativa de la zona. Además realizan actividades en conjunto, como rifas y polladas para lograr un fondo de Caja de Auxilio, para los casos que alguien se enferme, o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación.

De acuerdo a las actividades de la señoras, destinarán los fondos del crédito para compra de mercaderías; en caso de las despensas, compra de carne, queso , leche, vino, sidra, teniendo en cuenta las fechas de fiesta. En el caso de las vendedoras de ropas, compra de ropas de fiesta y de niños. En el caso de las señoras de venta de comida, pretenden invertir en otros ramos como venta de juguetes y fuegos artificiales, aprovechando las fiestas. Además, quienes se dedican a la venta de bebidas o despensas, desean anexar la venta de helados y otras bebidas heladas, ya que se viene la época de mayor calor.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, such as meat, cheese, milk, wine, cider, toys, fireworks, etc.

loans.name: Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen B. is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a baby lock machine in order to improve the services that she proves to customers.

texts.en:
