loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell

loans.name: José Lino

texts.es:
After Jose Lino had a terrible accident that made it impossible for him to carry heavy loads, he started a business selling used clothing so that he could carry on supporting his wife and children.

His business has been through good times and bad and, for now, Jose doesn't have enough inventory to offer his customers who want to buy presents over the holidays and/or cold-weather clothing for themselves. Consequently, Jose is asking for a loan of US$475, to be repaid in 2 months, to buy merchandise that he will resale to his customers. With your help, Jose will be able to pull his family ahead despite the problems they face.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Después de que José Lino tuvo un terrible accidente que lo dejó con imposibilitado para cargar cosas pesadas puesto que una de sus piernas no puede soportar pesos grandes es por eso que comenzó a vender ropa usada para poder obtener un dinero que le sirva para mantener a su esposa e hijos.

Sin embargo el negocio que él está manejando tiene temporadas buenas y malas y en este momento José no tiene suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes que están buscando algo que regalarle a sus familiares y/o ropa de frío que le pueda servir a uno de sus clientes, es por eso que José está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 2 meses y con este dinero José podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener algo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda José podrá sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de sus problemas.

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Reyna María

texts.es:
Reyna has two children. As the result of a traffic accident, her daughter is very sick and can’t manage on her own. Her husband’s income as a janitor at an elementary school is not enough to cover the household expenses. For that reason, in order to obtain an extra income for the family, Reyna decided to start selling beauty products by catalog, door-to-door.

In order to meet her daughter’s needs, little by little and with great effort, she has increased her clientele. However, she presently has orders that she has not been able to complete, as she doesn’t have the money to buy the merchandise. She is requesting a $475 loan, which she is committed to repay in six months. With it, Reyna will be able to stock up for the orders she already has and obtain the money to pay for her daughter’s medicines. With your help, Reyna will be able to ensure the well-being of her family, in spite of the accident.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna tiene dos hijos, de los cuales una hija está muy enferma, puesto que un día la atropellaron y ya no puede valerse por si misma. Con lo que gana su esposo como conserje en una escuela primaria no les alcanza para pagar todos los gastos de su casa. Es por eso que Reyna decidió comenzar a vender productos de belleza por catálogo casa por casa, para poder obtener un ingreso extra para su familia.

Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo para que su hija no le haga falta nada, ha ido incrementando la cantidad de clientes. Sin embargo, actualmente tiene pedidos que no ha podido surtir, puesto que no tiene dinero suficiente para poder comprar la mercancía. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $475, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses. Con este dinero Reyna podrá comprar los pedidos que ya le hicieron y así sacar dinero para poder pagar las medicinas de su hija. Con tu ayuda, Reyna podrá sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de este accidente.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa Guadalupe has been a make-up independent salesperson for over three years. She's been doing this in order to help her sister; once she found out this money was giving her a steady income she decided to continue it on her own. She would sell from the catalog among her friends and neighbors. The main reason she became an independent consultant was because she didn't have any money to support her 4 children. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. With so many expenses, she decided to embark in this career.

However, her current situation has not been able to improve since she needs to purchase winter clothes and food for her kids. She is not able to purchase the beauty products she needs in order to sell them to others. This is becoming a vicious cycle which she needs to break, for this reason she is requesting a loan for the amount of $300. She is willing to re-pay it within 6 months. With this money Rosa would be able to sell her products and then get a steady income which will help her support her family and expand the goods she has to offer. With your support Rosa will be able to improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Guadalupe hace tres años que se independizó en la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, puesto que hace tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta de estos productos al ayudarle a su hermana, y tiempo después se dio cuenta que el negocio si estaba dejando dinero por lo tanto comenzó a vender por catálogo a sus vecinas y amigos. La razón principal por la que se independizó fue que no tenía dinero para pagar los gastos de sus cuatro hijos, el mayor tiene 12 años y el menor tiene 1 año. Por lo tanto los gastos de sus hijos fue lo que la motivó a emprender un negocio por su cuenta.

Sin embargo la situación actualmente no la deja superarse puesto que con los gastos de ropa de invierno para sus niños y la comida no puede tener un dinero ahorrado para poder comprar los productos que le piden y por lo tanto se va haciendo una cadena de vicios que Rosa está dispuesta a romper, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rosa podrá tener dinero para poder vender productos y así obtener ganancias para poder costear los gastos de su familia y al mismo tiempo ahorrar un poco para resurtir su negocio. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
It's been 8 years since Josefina C. got divorced, leaving her in charge of three kids which she has to support since her husband doesn't offer economic support. For this reason, she decided to sell beauty products through catalog among her friends. With lots of effort she's been able to move her kids ahead offering them an education and making sure they are able to take care for themselves. She doesn't want the same to happen to them.

However, Josefina is actually applying for a loan in order to be able to buy merchandise this holiday season. This way she have different beauty products to offer her clients.The loan she is requesting is of $425 which will be available to be repaid within 4 months. With this money Josefina will be able to purchase more merchandise and be able to offer a wider variety to her clients. With your help Josefina will be able to support her kids, offer them the education they need and be able to send them to college.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 8 años que Josefina C. se divorció, quedándose a cargo de 3 hijos de los cuales ella tiene que mantener, puesto que su esposo no le brinda la manutención necesaria. Es por eso que decidió comenzar a vender productos de belleza por catálogo entre sus amistades. Y con mucho esfuerzo va sacando poco a poco adelante a sus hijos brindándoles estudio para que ellos sean unas personas de bien y no pasen por lo mismo que está pasando Josefina.

Sin embargo actualmente Josefina está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mercancía para esta temporada navideña y así tener algo que ofrecerles a sus clientes para los regalos. El crédito que está solicitando es de US $425 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Josefina podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad en sus productos. Con tu ayuda Josefina podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos para que tengan estudios universitarios.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Joweria's Group

texts.en:
Joweria N. is requesting a loan for business expansion to stock more raw food, depending on the season. She also wants to purchase a fridge to preserve her perishable stock like tomatoes.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her business

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
